loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru: Муртазо родился в 1967 году. Женат имеет троих  детей.  Он работает таксистом уже 10 лет.  Это является его единственным доходом.  Его старая автомашина уже не исправна но чтобы купить новую у него не хватает денежных средств, поэтому Муртазо   обратился в нашу организацию за кредитом. Он планирует на полученный кредит  купить новую автомашину.  Он очень благодарен Арванду, за то, что его поддерживают   в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Murtazo was born in 1983. He is married and has three children. Murtazo has been working as a taxi driver for ten years and this is the sole source of income for his family. His old taxi cab is in bad shape but Murtazo doesn't have enough savings to purchase a new vehicle.He has turned to KIVA for a loan which he will use to purchase a new taxi cab. Murtazo is very grateful to Arvand for their support during this difficult time.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru:
Далер проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 24 года. Он холост. Далер живет с родителями. Его мать занимается торговлей. Сам Далер работает таксистом. Он занимается развозками пассажиров и перевозками по городу. В этой области Далер шесть лет. 
Далер берет кредит для того чтобы оплатить оставшиеся деньги за приобретенную новую автомашину.
texts.en: Daler lives in Dushanbe. He is 24 years old and single. Daler lives with his parents. His mother works in retail and Daler works as a taxi driver. He offers shuttle services and deliveries within city limits. Daler has had his taxi business for six years. Daler is taking out this loan to pay back his debt for purchasing a car.

loans.use: to pay back a loan he took out to purchase a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema is 60 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling ice-cake in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Tumema has requested a loan to buy cordials, sugar, large spoon, and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tumema will help with her families expenses.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, large spoons, and foam cups

loans.name: Jaliya

texts.en:
Jaliya is a 38-year-old mother of 1 child. Her child is 15 years old and goes to school.

She has been selling clothes for the last 22 years and also has some cows and bananas she tends to on a small farm. Right now Jaliya sells her clothes on the ground in the market but in the future she wants to rent a big shop to sell them from. Her biggest challenge is competition from other people selling clothes in the market. With her profits from the business she sends her child to school.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Edis Alberto

texts.es:
Edis, necesita aplicarle fertilizantes a su siembra de maíz y yuca, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de dichos abonos y herbicidas, esto le ayudara a mejorar su cosecha fortaleciendo la platacion para que esta se encuentre libre de plagas y sea mas abundante la cosecha.
El comenta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar la cosecha pasada, con mejores resultados en la produccion, pudo sembrar 3 metros más de terreno de yuca, gracias a ello han podido incrementar su economía.
texts.en:
Edis needs a loan so that he can apply fertilizers to his corn and cassava crops. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy compost and herbicides. This will help him improve his crops and strengthen his plantings to keep them free of pests and to achieve a more abundant harvest.

Edis says that his previous loan helped him improve his last harvest. He attained better production results as a result of planting an additional three square meters of land with cassava. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Savalii

texts.en: Savali is 64 years old and a widow with 8 children. She runs a small business selling keke-puaa (pork bun) in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Savali has requested a loan to not only to improve her business, but do some repairs on her home as well. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Savali will help provide for her children education and her family daily need.

loans.use: to pay for timber, cement, bricks, iron roof, oil, pots, cooking utensils, flour

loans.name: Kuymurod

texts.ru: Куймурод мужчина, в возрасте 23 лет, женат, пока  не имеет детей.  Куймурод уже в течение 10 лет занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого  скота.  За этот период он достиг много положительного результата.  Жена Куймурода в свободное время  помогает откармливанием скота дома. Он уже два года кредитуется в нашей организации.  В течение 2 лет не разу не нарушал политику организации и своевременно погашал свой полученный кредит. Куймурод ответственный, пунктуальный и честный человек. Он благодарен  таким организациям как Арванд за поддержку и понимание. На  полученный кредит Куймурод хочет расширить  свой бизнес в сфере животноводство и купить крупно рогатый скот.
texts.en: Kuymurod is a 23 year old married man without children. For the last 10 years Kuymurod has been raising cattle for resale and has reached many business milestones during this time. Kuymurod's wife helps feed the animals in her spare time. Kuymurod has been receiving loans from our organization for two years. He is responsible, punctual and honest man. He is grateful to organizations like Arvand for their support and understanding. Kuymurod is planning to use this loan to expand his cattle business and purchase more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for repairing the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим мужчина в возрасте. Он с 2010 года является нашим клиентам.  Он женат и имеет  троих детей.  Их семья  очень дружная и счастливая.  Его жена домохозяйка но в свободное время помогает мужу по откармливанию скота.  Сам Рахим  работает   врачом в своем кишлаке но  заработная плата очень маленькая. У них хороший  доход   от животноводство. Поэтому они стараются развивать этот бизнес. Рахим  на полученный кредит  хочет купить несколько голов скота. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Rahim is an older man. He has been our client since 2010. Rahim is married and a father of three children. His family is a happy one. Rahim's wife is a home maker but helps her husband on the farm in her spare time. Rahim is the village's doctor but his salary is very small. However, the family makes a good living selling cattle and they want to further develop this business. Rahim is very grateful for your support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Vaydullo

texts.ru: Вайдулло мужчина в возрасти 50 лет, женат, имеет троих детей.   В течение  уже 30 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур.   Он выращивает лук, пшеницу, кукурузу и другие сельскохозяйственной культуры. Кроме этого Вайдулло занимается откармливанием  крупно рогатого и мелко рогатого скота в этом ему помогает его жена.   Вайдулло очень старательный и добросовестный человек. Он старается чтобы его дети нормально жили а внуки  учились в высших учебных заведениях.   Вайдулло кредитуется в ООО МДО «Арванд» несколько лет, не разу не нарушал политику кредитования.   На полученный кредит  Вайдулло хочет  приобрести несколько голов скота.    Он очень благодарен  таким организациям как Арванд.
texts.en: Vaydullo is 50 years old, married and a father of three children. For the last 30 years Vaydullo has been working as a farmer. He grows onions, wheat, corn and other crops. He also raises livestock, a business which his wife helps him with. Vaydullo is a hardworking and conscientious man. He wants to make sure that his children have a good life and that his grandchildren will be able to attend university. Vaydullo has been taking out loans with "Arvand" for several years and has never broken the lending agreement. He is planning to use the current loan to purchase additional livestock. He is very grateful to organizations like Arvand.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón tiene 40 años de edad, casado, con 01 hijo dependiente de 02 años, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Chepito Olivos, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. Perteneciente al departamento de Lambayeque.

La actividad que realiza Simón, es la crianza y venta de animales, cliente cría mayormente ovejos y aves de corral. Los alimenta con pastos naturales, maíz, purina y otros. Simón cría sus animales en corrales hechos de caña, tablas y adobe, quincenalmente los negocia en mercados de Chiclayo.  Paralelamente, se desempeña como agricultor, tiene sembrado maíz en terreno de su señora madre.

Simón desea comprar alimento para su ganado, así como para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo.  Es por eso que ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Simón is 40 years old, married, and has a two-year-old child who is dependent on him. He lives in his own home in the village of Chepito Olivos, which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Mórrope in the Department of Lambayeque.

Simón’s business involves raising and selling animals. He raises mostly sheep and chickens. The food they eat consists of natural grasses, corn, Purina feed, and other items. Simón raises his animals in pens made of reeds, wooden planks, and adobe. The animals are sold every two weeks at the markets in Chiclayo. He also works as a farmer, planting corn on his mother’s land.

Simón wants to buy feed for his livestock as well as fertilizers for his crops. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло более 35 лет работает учителем. Он проживает в городе Дангара. Абдулло женат. Ему 59 лет. У него пятеро детей, одна девочка и четверо парней. Его жена вместе с дочерью занимаются домашним хозяйством. Старший сын Абдуллы агроном, второй в армии, третий студент а младший учится в средней школе. Абдулло два года как совмещает преподавание с торговлей. Он занимается торговлей. Абдулло рядом с домом открыл магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Abdullo has worked as a teacher for 35 years. He is a 59 year old resident of Dangara. Abdullos is married and a father of five children: one daughter and four sons. His wife and daughter take care of the home. Abdullo's eldest son works as an agronomist, the second one is in the army, the third one is a college  student and the youngest is still in school. For the last two years Abdullo has been combining teaching with running a business. Abdullo opened a grocery store next to his house which offers a variety for goods for sale. he is taking out this loan to purchase more groceries so that he can expand his inventory and increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Sulimauga

texts.en: Sulimauga is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as soft drinks, sugar, cigarettes, flour, onions etc. She has been doing this for 4 years. Sulimauga needs a loan to buy soft drinks, noodles, onions, cigarettes, and canned food her shop. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, onions, cigarettes and canned food

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María, desea comprar dos cerdos y todo lo necesario para su mantenimiento, es por eso que ella está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de los cerdos, maíz, maicillo y concentrado, en general todo lo que necesite para su engorde, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ganancias y mejorar su estabilidad en la granja.

Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo en la compra de cerdos, ademas realizo una siembra de maíz y gracias a ello se ha podido mantener económicamente y también a su familia.
texts.en:
María wants to buy two pigs and everything she needs to raise them. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan to buy pigs, corn, sorghum, and concentrated feed. In general, this is everything she needs to fatten them. These pigs will help improve her earnings and the stability of her farm.

María says that her previous loan helped her to buy pigs and plant a crop of corn. As a result, she has been able to maintain her finances and also support her family.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Jaime Nolberto

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 48 años de edad, es separado y tiene 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla Jaime, es el servicio de moto lineal, transportando pasajeros por los diferentes caseríos del valle. Cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia. Complementariamente cría ganado ovino el cual al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado de la zona.   Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Jaime busca siempre incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Es por ello que con ese afán ha decidido comprarse una moto lineal y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jaime is 48 years old, separated from his spouse, and has two children under his care. He lives in his own home located in the village of Pueblo Libre in the District of Tambogrande. Jaime lives in the rural part of the district and does not receive basic services.

Jaime’s business involves providing off-road motorcycle services. He transports passengers to different villages within the valley. Jaime has more than three years of experience. At the same, he raises sheep until they reach the ideal size and weight before selling them at the local market. With the income he generates from his business activities, Jaime is able to cover the expenses for himself and his family.

He is always looking for ways to increase his income and improve his quality of life. For this reason, Jaime decided that he should buy an off-road motorcycle. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 1,200 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy an off-road motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo en su negocio de meriendas, es por eso que nuevamente está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de leña, maíz, aceite, gas y otros, esto le permitirá seguir con su negocio y mejorar su clientela.
Ella comenta que con los créditos anteriores a seguido creciendo en el negocio, ella sigue con su venta no tiene mayores problemas y sus ganancias han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rosa needs more operating capital for her snack business. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan so that she can buy firewood, corn, oil, gas, and other supplies. This will enable her to continue her business and improve her clientele.

Rosa says that her previous loans allowed her to grow her business. She continues to make sales without any major problems. As a result, her earnings have improved.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, oil, gas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to stock his store.

loans.name: Leuma

texts.en: Leuma is 56 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling keke puaa (steamed pork buns) in her community and has been doing this for two years. Leuma has requested a loan to purchase more supplies for her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leuma will continue her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for supplies such as flour, sugar, salt, onions, soy sauce and a gas oven

loans.name: Fegauiai

texts.en:
Fegauiai is 31 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as soft drinks, snacks, canned food, noodles, and flour. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Fegauiai needs a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, canned food, noodles, flour and sugar for her shop. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her childrens' education. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, canned food, noodles, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi has been selling seafood for approximately seven years. She started out working as a farmer but then decided to establish her own business selling fish. Mwanamkasi gradually grew her business and has built up a good clientele over many years. She wakes up at 6:00 A.M. and heads to the docks where the fishing boats arrive. She is a married woman with four grown children. With this loan, she wants to buy fish, a frying pan, and cooking oil. Among her goals are to grow her business, to have enough capital to start another business, and to have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy fish, a frying pan, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en: Kuini is 42 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling handy crafts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy tools and wood supplies. In the future, Kuini hopes to expand her business and to save more money for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to its financial services.

loans.use: to buy wood, coconut shells and a sharpener for her craft business

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is 25 years old and married, with no children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Filipina needs a loan to buy equipment, chemicals and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Filipina will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and to save some more money for her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizers, weed killer and bush knives for her business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan sells fish as a means of generating income for himself. Hassan, 32, lives in Msambweni, a town on the south coast of Kenya. Hassan delivers fish to his existing customers. One of the problems that he faces is seasonality, since some fish become scarce at some periods. He has been fishing for the past 12 years and has gained a lot of experience.

With this loan, Hassan will buy more fishing nets. Among his goals are to grow his business and to open a fish depot in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years old, married, and has four children.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional snack foods, noodles and other grocery items to sell.

Nancy has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nancy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional snack foods, noodles and other grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Edjromede 4 Group

texts.fr: EDJROMEDE 4 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Ahinadjè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Isidore. Le couple a six enfants dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ahinadjè et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Ahinadjè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a dix neuf années environs que Ahinadjè mène comme activité la vente de glacières à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Ahinadjè prépare de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce), qu'elle vend à son domicile. Ahinadjè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Ahinadjè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Ahinadjè sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe EDJROMEDE 4. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité et à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle.
texts.en: EDJROMEDE 4 is a group of three people whose members belong to the same savings group.  The representative of the group, Ahinadje (with her hand raised in the photo) is 37-years old and married to a chauffeur named Isidore.  The couple have six dependent children, some of which attend school.  Ahinadje and her husband live together with their children and they take care of the different household expenses together.  Ahinadje did not attend school.  About nineteen years ago, she started selling ice chests from home.  Parallel to this business, she prepares food (rice with sauce) that she sells from home.  Ahinadje is passionate about her business which enables her to take care of her needs and those of her children.  Ahinadje stocks up at a market in Benin. In pursuit of customer satisfaction, Ahinadje is asking for a first loan with the other members of Edjromede 4. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business and better respond to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice, condiments, and ice chests.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.
 
Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 23,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase bread, sugar, shampoo and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, sugar, shampoo and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn previously accessed an 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase products for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Evelyn would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy more products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available, the better her profits will be. These earnings will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evelyn hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members* to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 59, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elizabeth operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elizabeth hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business . She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cloth, thread, fabric and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
At 34 years old, Anthony is a commercial farmer. He is married and a hard-working man who has no children yet. 

He does farming with his wife, selling their farm produce both from home and at the market.  He wants to expand his farming activities and have more produce for sale. The challenge he currently faces is that he does not have enough capital to do so. 

For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy farm equipment, fertiliser, and pesticides and cover cultivation expenses.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment, fertiliser, and pesticides and cover cultivation expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more motor parts to resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, age 30, is responsible and hardworking. She has the drive to succeed in order to have a better life. Joyce lives with her husband and her four children.

Joyce has a store where she sells food, household goods, personal use products, and other items. Her business is very stable and generates acceptable income. Despite this, Joyce wants to improve the earnings from her store and purchase large quantities of basic necessities such as flour, detergents, milk, beverages, and other items. This will enable her to serve more people and improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities such as flour, detergents, milk, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is married with two children. Romeo is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Romeo is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years and every month he earns 8,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Romeo is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Romeo hopes to see his children finish their studies and to gain double income out of his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ana Editha

texts.en:
This is Ana Editha, who is 42 years old and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Ana Editha operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resells them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and like products.  Customers are attracted to buy by her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ana Editha hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing and merchandise items.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 53 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last five years by selling home and used products.

Amelita makes 3,000 Philippine pesos a month and is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

She is a new member of Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. She joined GDMPC and made the loan as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 30 years old and is married to Mr. Kalama. They have a two-year-old son and live in Msambweni in their own house.

Margaret sells cloth and has been able to have a steady customer base. She also sells fruits and vegetables in the same locale.

With the help from the loan, she will buy bales of cloth so as to be able to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandize and be able to offer a greater variety of items to her customers; that will strengthen her investment.

Margaret wishes to open a general store in future.

loans.use: to buy bales of cloth

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is 28 years old, married, and has four children. He and his family live in the town of Msambweni, Kenya.

Four years ago, Abdalla decided to buy a motorcycle taxi and provide transportation to anyone who needs to travel within the community and the surrounding areas. In addition to this, he sells fish, though his wife mostly operates this business.  

He is requesting his second loan from Yehu in the amount of 50,000 KES. The money will be used to buy a new motorcycle so that he can provide better service to his customers and continue generating income. His goal is to work hard so that his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: FIFA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Kèlomè Estelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Rodrigue. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Kèlomè Estelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges des enfants. Kèlomè Estelle a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Il y a environs deux ans que Kèlomè Estelle mène comme activité la vente d'articles de mercerie dans une ville du Bénin afin de contribuer aux divers besoins du ménage. Kèlomè Estelle exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Kèlomè Estelle s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Kèlomè Estelle sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: FIFA is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Kelome Estelle (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 33-years old and married to a Rodrigue.  The couple have three children, all attending school, two of which are dependent on them.  Kelome Estelle lives together with her husband and her children.  The couple share the various children's expenses.  Kelome Estelle stopped attending school at the secondary level.  About two years ago, she started a business selling haberdashery in a city in Benin in order to contribute to the various household expenses.  Kelome Estelle is passionate about her work which enables her to take care of her needs and those of her children.  Kelome Estelle stocks up in a city in Benin. In pursuit of customer satisfaction, Kelome Estelle is asking for a fourth loan with the other members of FIFA group.  This loan will allow them to better meet customer demand and earn more profit.  Their prior loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery.

loans.name: Taphroza

texts.en:
Taphroza is 45 years old, a widowed lady, but she takes care of her four children aged between 21 to 25 years.

Taphroza is an entrepreneur and has been operating a clothes-selling business for the last three years. From this business, she is able to make a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking out her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of dresses, skirts and jeans. Her profits will be used to purchase more dresses and also stationery for her other (printing) business.

Her dream is to have big clothing and printing businesses.

loans.use: To buy a stock of dresses, skirts and jeans.

loans.name: Naxhije

texts.en:
Naxhije is married and has two children. She lives in the Ashklai community in Kosovo. Like in the Roma community, the residents of the Ashkali community live in unacceptable conditions. At this time Naxhije lives in an old house, which needs two rooms and the toilet fixed. 

Naxhije works with her husband reselling old/used shoes that they purchase in a local market. She is requesting a loan in order to fix the rooms and toilet. This loan will help the family to improve their living conditions including sanitary needs. 

Naxhije hopes in the future to work more and increase the profit from her business. Her goal is to save money for her children’s education. 

Naxhije appreciates Kiva support very much!

loans.use: To repair two rooms and fix the toilet

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Melba requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more purified drinking water to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Melba would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is married, with three children to care for.  She is 29 years old and lives in Basirang, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

To earn a living she sells personal products, such as shoes, dresses, sandals, and more. She loves fashion and new trends, and that entices her to engage in such activity. She has been operating this business for five years and earns PHP 8,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to obtain more products to sell. Marifel is a new member of the cooperative. 

In the future, Marifel hopes to be more progressive in this venture and would like to be able to widen the facility and product offerings to attract more customers.

loans.use: to obtain more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Henure

texts.en:
Henure is 43 years of age, married to Teresa, and blessed with four children aged 17, 14, eight and six years. He owns a carpentry shop, a business he started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 23,000. 


He has requested a second loan of KES 50,000 to purchase a plywood machine, sandpaper and timber. The profit he earns will aid him to expand his workshop. His dream is to prosper in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a plywood machine, sandpaper and timber.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina, She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase supplies like glass, stainless steel materials, silicon and other materials used in the business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy supplies like glass, stainless steel materials, silicon and other materials used in the business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosalina hopes to expand her business soon and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies like glass, stainless steel materials, silicon and other materials used in the business

loans.name: Miblononvi Group

texts.fr: MIBLONONVI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Mathilde (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un certain Dominique. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés, dont trois à leur charge. Mathilde et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Mathilde a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Il y a dix années environs que Mathilde mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (conserves, vivres, savons, bombons, etc.) dans son quartier. Mathilde exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Mathilde s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mathilde sollicite un cinquième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MIBLONONVI. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: MIBLONONVI is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Mathilde (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 48-years old and married to a Dominique.  The couple have four children, all attending school, three of which are dependent on them.  Mathilde and her husband live together with their children and they take care of the different household expenses together.  Mathilde stopped school at the secondary level.  About 10 years ago, Mathilde started a business selling various products (canned goods, food, soap, candy, etc.) in her neighborhood.  She is passionate about her business which enables her to take care of her needs and the needs of her children.  Mathilde stocks up at a market in Benin. In pursuit of customer satisfaction, Mathilde is asking for her fifth loan with the other members of the Miblononvi Group.  This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy food, canned goods, candy, and cookies.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 42 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have five children between 5 and 20. All of his children attend schools. 

He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seed and to support labor costs. He plans to use the profits to pay school fees and make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seed and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is a 37-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Emmanuel and they have three children, age 13, 10 and 6 years.

Milicent operates a retail shop, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her second loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, baking flour and eggs. 

Her profits will be used to add more stock to the business. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice, sugar, baking flour and eggs.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 47 years old. He is married to a businesswoman. He has four children between 4 and 19. All of his children attend schools. 

He has been a maize farmer for eight years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. With the profits, he wants to gain more out puts from his farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.es:
Melisa de 19 años quien a pesar de su edad le ha valido en grande su firme compromiso con el trabajo y con Edgar su pareja con quien logro concebir a su pequeña Elizabeth de 4 años, todo lo logrado es para ella según cuenta. Este joven hogar tiene espacio en una vivienda construida a base de madera. Al iniciar una vida con Edgar se aunó  a las labores que el desempeñaba desde hace 10  años en el campo cuya actividad principal es la producción de cacao y café, de esta manera juntos lograron consolidarla un equipo enrumbado en el progreso.
La labor siempre le llamo la atención por ser un trabajo colectivo y con buenas ganancias debido a la demanda, sin embargo en la última temporada se vieron afectados por el precio que los acopiadores otorgaron , sin embargo comentan esto ocurre de vez en cuando ya que es imposible mantener un precio estable cuando se trata de productos agropecuarios.
Paralelo a ello tiene pensado iniciar con la siembra de árboles madereros ya que a futuro considera es una buena manera seguir sacando el máximo provecho a los terrenos de manera responsable.
Finalizada la época de cosecha, tiene la necesidad de realizar un deshierbo correspondiente debido a que la maleza se desarrolló  de manera vertiginosa en sus árboles de cacao y es necesario contar con jornaleros para la limpieza del mismo  así como la compra de abono orgánico indispensable para una producción de calidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, muy agradecida por la confianza promete corresponder de manera responsable con el pago de sus cuotas ya que tiene en mente seguir accediendo un mayor crédito. Así mismo agradece a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por la acogida brindada.
Con los 500 complementara su capital para adquirir abonos orgánicos y la contrata de jornaleros para el deshierbo de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
In spite of 19 year old Melisa’s age, her firm commitment to work and her life partner, Edgar, with whom she has little four year old Elizabeth, has greatly helped her.  She says that everything she has accomplished is for her daughter.

This young household is located in a house made of wood.  Upon starting a life with Edgar, she joined the work that he has been doing in the field for ten years.  Her main business activity is producing cacao and coffee.  This way, together, they have strengthened a team that is moving towards progress.

The work has always caught her attention for being a collective job with good income due to the demand.  Nevertheless, they were affected by the prices that were set at the collection sites.

Alongside this work, she is planning on starting to grow timber trees.  This is because she feels that, in the future, it would be a good way to continue getting the maximum advantage of the land in a responsible way.

After the harvest season she needs to do the appropriate weeding.  The weeds develop at a dizzying pace around her cacao trees.  She needs to hire day workers to clear the fields, and she needs to buy the indispensable organic fertilizer for a quality production.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the trust shown in her, and she pledges to make her payments responsibly.  This is because she plans to continue and to get a larger loan.

She is grateful to her colleagues in her communal bank for the warm welcome she received.

She will add the 500 to her capital in order to get organic fertilizers and to hire the day workers to weed her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Pauline est une dame âgée de 38 ans qui fait dans la vente des vivres frais et secs depuis pratiquement 09 ans. Elle achète le maïs, le manioc, les tomates, les condiments verts et bien d'autres produits vivriers qu'elle revend sur comptoir dans un marché de la ville. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter du maïs et du manioc sec en grande quantité pour renforcer son stock de marchandise afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui va grandissante. les bénéfices générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Pauline is a 38-year old woman who has been selling fresh and dry food for almost nine years.  She buys corn, manioc, tomatoes, green condiments and other food products which she resells at a counter in the city market.  She would like this loan to buy corn and dried manioc in large quantities to increase her inventory in order to satisfy growing customer demand.  The profits she earns will enable her to better meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and dry manioc.

loans.name: Assiya

texts.en:
Assiya is 37 years old. She is married to a businessman. She has 5 children, aged between 6 and 20. All of her children are enrolled in schools. She has been a maize farmer for 4 years. She wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. With the profits, she wants to pay school fees for the children.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Gahraman

texts.en: Gahraman is 35 years old and married. His business is the production of milk, which he has done for 12 years. He currently has two dairy cows that are producing. His wife and sister help him in his work and in selling the milk. The house where he lives is owned by his family. He lives with his parents and his family. The loan of 1500 AZN is for home repair, to make better living conditions for his household.  Gahraman is an honest and hard-working young man.

loans.use: To make repairs at home.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. She is IDP (an internally displaced person) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Zeynab has raised cattle and cows for 18 years. She was a housewife and her husband was on pension when she decided to start her own business. 

Zeynab usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 70 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Zeynab also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.
 
She wants to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family. She applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase two cattle, two milk cows and fodder. This will be her third loan and Zeynab has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, two milk cows and fodder.

loans.name: Umud

texts.en:
Umud is an entrepreneurial person who is married and has one son, age 17. 

He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. He raises and sells sheep, cheese and wool in the local market and has many customers. He wants to increase his husbandry business and from the income to build a stall for his animals to care better for them and to attract a large number of customers. 

Umud is looking for a loan to buy more sheep. He will then be able to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings.

loans.use: To buy more sheep.

loans.name: Telesphore

texts.en:
Telesphore, age 60, is married, and he and his wife have six children. 

He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. With the profits, he plans to develop his family through providing the basic needs.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 53 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 22 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to help the poor neighboring.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Fenina

texts.en:
Fenina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. Fenina has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Fenina is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Fely works hard to support her family. She has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Fely is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream vending business

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
This is Florife. She previously accessed an 27,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from  the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florife hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams to give her family a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, allowing her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 72 years old, married, and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonisa runs a business buying and selling nipa ( woven palm mats use for house repair and constructions) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.  Leonisa has been in this business for 13 years.  In the future, Leonisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 47. She is married to a businessman. She has five children, aged between 6 and 19.  All of her children attend schools. She has been a maize farmer for 15 years. She wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to beautify, clean, and create a friendly environment at her home.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: La Grâce De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LA GRÂCE DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Esther (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à Stanislas, un soudeur. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leur charge. Esther et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Esther a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a une quinzaine d’année que Esther mène comme activité la vente de produits de toilette et de tissus par le système d livraison. Esther exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Esther s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Esther sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe LA GRÂCE DE DIEU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: LA GRÂCE DE DIEU is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Esther (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 48-years old and married to Stanislas, a welder.  The couple have five children, all attending school, two of which are their dependents.  Esther and her husband live together with their children and take care of the different household expenses together.  Esther stopped attending school at the secondary level.  About 15 years ago, Esther started a business selling toiletries and fabric by delivery.  Esther is passionate about her business which enables her to take care of her needs and those of her children.  Esther stocks up at a market in Benin. In pursuit of customer satisfaction, Esther is asking for a fourth loan with the other members of the La Grace de Dieu Group. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to make more profit.  The prior loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy toiletries and fabric.

loans.name: Qafar

texts.en:
Qafar is a 43 year-old man, an internally displaced person who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 14 years. During these years Qafar gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in an Azerbaijan family and also are used in fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Qafar wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1900 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Adigozal

texts.en:
Adigozal is a 42-year-old man who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children. He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 8 years. During these years Adigozal gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand.
 
People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Adigozal usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN.

As his products are in high demand, Adigozal wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,600 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. Adigozal is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest and this will be his third loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used cloths to resell

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru: Собиру 47  лет, он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Более 11 лет он работает в средней школе учителем музыки и имеет дополнительный доход от услуги певца. Он преподносить свои услуги в разных мероприятиях как певец.  Несмотря на все его усилия и старания его доход не позволяет ему отремонтировать крышу дома. Собир запрашивает займ на сумму 6000  сомони для покупки строительных материалов как шифер для ремонта крыши его дома. Собир  и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en:
Sobir is a 47-year-old married man with two children. For more than 11 years, he has been a high school music teacher, but he also works as a singer at various events for extra income. 

Despite his efforts, Sobir's income is not enough to cover the expense of repairing the roof of his home. He is requesting a 6000 somoni loan to purchase construction materials, such as slate, to repair his roof. Sobir and his children are waiting for kind lenders to assist them in solving this problem.

loans.use: To buy slate for repairing the roof of his house

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 49 year-old woman, an internally displaced person who lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is married and has one son. She raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as pomegranates, queen-apples, pears and cherries. In summer, she raises fruits and in autumn-winter, vegetables, such as potatoes, pumpkins and carrots. 

Her monthly income is 120 AZN. She usually sells her crops to the local market vendors. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Her husband helps her a lot in raising crops.

She applied for 2000 AZN to buy more seeds and fertilizers. This will be her third loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Virgencita De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El Comite Virgencita de Caacupé es del Chaco, está saliendo adelante y gracias al esfuerzo de todas ellas ya están en su tercer ciclo. Son mujeres que pese a su pobreza luchan por salir adelante y dejar todo lo malo atrás.
Myrian, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería y también vende bebidas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora como se puede ver, y es gracias a estos trabajos que hace, que esta pudiendo salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Myrian solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, para poder tener un buen stock de ese producto y de esa forma poder dar buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: The group Virgencita de Caacupé is from Chaco. Thanks to the hard work of all of its members, this group is in its third loan cycle. These are women who, despite of their poverty, struggle to get ahead, leaving all of their difficulties behind them. Myrian, one of the Virgencita de Caacupé members, makes a living selling notions (trinkets, sewing materials, fabrics and supplies) as well as soft drinks. Myrian is a very hardworking woman, as you can see, and thanks to her labors has been able to help her family get ahead. Myrian is requesting this loan to buy soft drinks to stock her store, and in this way, offer a wide variety of goods to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is from a small village of the Samtredia district. He is 33 years old and lives with his large family: wife, son, parents, brother, daughter-in-law and niece. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, Zaza runs a small dairy farm. He has a calf and a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, he has a pig and sells, on average, 10-15 piglets per year. Besides, Zaza owns a nut garden, and the family does all the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold locally. In addition, Zaza owns a car and serves the local people as a taxi driver. He is very hard-working man, with a rich experience in his work.

Zaza requested a loan to refurbish and maintain his car. It is damaged, and he is forced to stop working. After the car is repaired, he'll be able to continue working and give his customers better service. This will increase the family's income, and Zaza will improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: To refurbish and maintain his car

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing taro plants and banana trees to earn a living. Sharon has requested a loan to buy tools and equipment to start her own business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Sharon will use her profits to expand her business and to save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, bush knives and fertilizer.

loans.name: Benedo

texts.es:
Benedo tiene 53 años de edad,  es soltero y vive con su madre, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío San Martin en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y aun  no cuenta con servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla Benedo es la venta y crianza de ganado menor, los cuales engorda y una vez con peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en mercado local. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio. También se dedica a la agricultura y cuenta con 0,5 has de terreno agrícola.

El destino del crédito será para compra de animales para su posterior venta.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.  Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benedo is 53 years old, unmarried and lives with his mother in the village of San Martin in Tambogrande district. He lives in the rural part of the district, which lacks basic amenities.

Benedo raises small animals, which he fattens and when they reach an ideal weight, sells in the local market. He has had five years of experience in this business. He is also a farmer and has a half of hectare (about 1.2 acres) of land.

He will use the loan to purchase animals to sell and has asked for S/. 2,000 from Edpyme Alternativa. This investment will enable him to continue growing and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase small animals to  sell.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Adelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. Adelia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Adelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Kamile

texts.en:
Kamile is a 41-year-old married woman. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her husband and one daughter. She raises fruits and vegetables in her garden. She started this business 10 years ago. She chose this field because fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan and people like to eat them fresh and make fresh juices, which is very healthy. 

Her husband gets a pension and helps Kamile to sell crops in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are on every table in Azerbaijan, and 
families also make fresh punch. Raising crops and working in the open air takes a lot of strength, which is very hard for woman and that why her husband helps Kamile. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover.  For this purpose she applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sakura

texts.en:
Sakura is a 40-year-old woman. She is divorced and raises her one beloved son. She is an IDP. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has 12 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Sakura usually sells her crop to the market vendors in her area. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch.  Her monthly income is 100 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength, in addition to working in the open air. This is very hard work, and that's why her son helps her. 

She needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover.  For this purpose, she has applied for 1700 AZN. This will be her second loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, She previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her Xerox machine. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of school supplies and for the maintenance of her Xerox machine. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her daughter a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of school supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 40 years old. She is married to a farmer. They have three children, and all of the children attend school. She has been a maize farmer for 20 years. She wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por 18 mujeres muy activas, ellas trabajan siempre con mucho entusiasmo y unidad, la Srta. Carmen, una de las miembros, ella es la presidenta del grupo y  tiene la labor de guiarlas y mantener la unidad del grupo, están en el ciclo número 12 del programa.
Carmen vende bebidas de todo tipo, como ser cervezas, gaseosas, vinos, etc. Comenta que por medio de este trabajo progresa y está saliendo adelante y también ayuda a su familia. Ella desea seguir creciendo y de esa forma aumentar sus ingresos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, vinos, y demás, con lo cual puede abastecerse y surtirse y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is made up of eighteen very active women. They always work with enthusiasm and unity. Carmen, one of the members, is the president of the group and has the job of guiding them and maintaining the unity of the group. They are in their twelfth loan cycle with this program. Carmen sells all kinds of drinks, such as beer, soft drinks, wine, etc. She tells us that through this work she makes progress and is coming out ahead, and also helping her family. She wishes to continue growing and in this way increase her income. 
She is requesting the loan in order to buy drinks, such as soft drinks, wine, and other items, with which she'll stock up and supply her business and in this way fulfill her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, wine, and other items.

loans.name: Buscando La Calidad De Vida En La Comunidad Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, tiene 10 miembros, que están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a salir adelante. Ellas han demostrado unión y solidaridad las unas con las otras.
Miryan es una de las miembros, ella cuenta que desde siempre ha tenido que trabajar, es una persona que tiene muchos deseos de progresar y de salir adelante, tiene muchas metas y objetivos que desea cumplir. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo  y es gracias a este trabajo está saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, como ser short, camisas, remeras, camisillas y demás. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Curuguaty. It is composed of 10 members who are learning to work together and get ahead. They have shown unity and solitarity with one another.

Miryan is one of the members. She notes that she has always had to work and that she is a person eager to succeed and get ahead. She has many goals she wants to achieve. She sells all kinds of clothing and, thanks to this work, she is making progress.

She is requesting a loan to purchase summer garments, such as shorts, shirts, T-shirts, tank tops and other items. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, shirts, T-shirts, tank tops and other items.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganchimeg is a 60-year-old widow who lives with her daughter, aged 40, in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. She used to be a herder in the country-side. When she moved to the center of the province, she started selling groceries by retail in a rented store in the black market for three years. 

Now she is planning to open a small food store right beside her house. She says that "There is no other food store near here so opening a small food store will be profitable". She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy goods from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, for her small food store.

loans.use: To buy goods from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, for her small food store.

loans.name: Narly

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Narly works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Narly is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Narly has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Tufoua

texts.en:
Tufoua is 54 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling twistes, german buns, donuts and fried chicken in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy everything she needs for her business. 

In the future, Tufoua hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, baking soda, sugar and twisties.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
This is Jennie, 25, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ferdinand, a painter, and mother to her child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She makes a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jennie hopes to give her child a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.
