loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Flores” es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 10 miembros, donde todas ellas trabajan incansablemente por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Orlinda es una de estas mujeres, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que ha demostrado muchas ganas de salir adelante y de mejorar. Ella tiene una despensa con todo lo que su barrio necesita para surtirles.
Orlinda solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras y frutas, con lo cual quiere mantener bien surtido su local y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The committee, "Las Flores" (Flowers), is located in the city of Santani. It is made up of 10 members, women who work tirelessly to progress forward and help their families. 

Orlinda is one of those women. She is a hard-working, determined, and has showed a great interest for their progress and improvement. 

She has a store that supplies the needs of the neighborhood. 

Orlinda is requesting this loan to purchase drinks, milk, baked goods, fruits, vegetables so she can be well-supplied and continue working.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, milk, baked goods, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricilla is 60 years old and married with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pricilla has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Pricilla requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Pricilla has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Pricilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorbike.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en:
Rajabgul is married and has two children. She always wanted to provide them with good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, she decided to start new business, dealing with animal husbandry, in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied and took a course 'to get ahead' given by a women's organization and gained business skills. She will be very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 600 TJS  to buy cattle to set up her new business. She will get through using the loan, and her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to set up her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stock needed for her rice-selling business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is a 30-year-old gentleman who is married to Tima. Together they have three children who are attending a local primary school. For the last three years, Mohamed has been selling fish through wholesale. His wife operates a retail shop from their home. He buys his fish directly from the fishermen before selling to the retailers by the kilo. He is requesting this loan so as to buy more stock of fish.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie, She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy additional supplies of chicken and pork needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of chicken and pork needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lanie hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling motorcycle spare parts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more spare parts for resale.

NWTF is relisting Angela's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people but on retail. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT–SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She generates additional income through selling clusters of green bananas. She has been in this business for eight years selling to all categories of people but on retail. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Baykishi

texts.en:
Baykishi is a 57-year-old man, married with three sons. He has bred cattle and cows for the last 20 years. During these years he gained necessary skills and knowledge for effective management of his business. 

He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells then for more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 150 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. He also makes home yoghurt and sells it together with fresh milk to neighbors.

Now Baykishi would like to buy more animals, and for this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN. He will buy three calves and one milk cow.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milk cow.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Sra Gladys es casada, ella es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, y nos cuenta que se dedica al comercio, en el cual trabaja hace 17 años. Ella vende todo tipo de productos, como bebidas, comestibles y demás.
Su negocio es muy concurrido y tiene muy buena clientela siempre y asi ella esta saliendo adelante.
La Sra. Gladys solicita este crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, ya que esta le será muy útil en su negocio para hacer reparticiones y todo tipo de trabajos. Comenta que le será de mucha ayuda, esta motocicleta y que desea invertir en su local.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is married and is from the city of Curuguaty. She notes that she has been a merchant for 17 years.  She sells all kinds of products such as drinks, food and other items.

Her place is always crowded and she has many good customers. Thus she is getting ahead.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle because it will be very useful in her business for making deliveries and all kinds of work. She notes that a motorcycle will be a great help and that she wants to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Arnaude Assiba

texts.fr: Agée de 27ans, Arnaude Assiba est célibataire sans enfant. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des boissons et de l'eau minérale depuis 5ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Arnaude Assiba is 27 years old, single, and has no children. She has a shop where she’s been selling drinks and mineral water for 5 years. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin. 

With the goal of strengthening her business and meeting the needs of her clients, she has asked for a microloan from Finadev, which will help her maximize her profits and meet her own needs.

loans.use: to buy five pallets of candy and five pallets of mineral water.

loans.name: Baby Liza

texts.en:
Baby Liza is 26 years old and has two children. Baby Liza is married and has one child who is in school.

Baby Liza is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Baby Liza requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Baby Liza has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Baby Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Apaau

texts.en:
Apaau is a 37-year-old married woman with four children. She would like to start growing taro plants and bananas to earn a living. 

Apaau has requested a loan to buy taro plants, chemical and equipment to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Apaau will use her profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy taro plants, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar continues fishing and selling his fish at the market, a business that has given him good results. He is a hard-working person who has the urge to move forward. 

He is asking for this loan to buy fishing nets. This way he will be able to increase stock and sell more fish especially this rainy season where there is availability of some kinds of fish which sell most. Thanks to the previous loan, he was able to have enough stock of fish to sell and as a result got an increased income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Laine

texts.en:
Laine is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing taro plants and bananas to earn a living. 

Laine has requested a loan to buy chemicals and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Laine will use her profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, bush knives and gloves.

loans.name: Aleksandra

texts.en:
Aleksandra is living in a minority community of Kosovo. She is married and has two children. The oldest is eleven years old and youngest is seven years old. She is a housewife, taking care of her children and the household needs. Her husband works in construction with a very low salary. His job is the family’s main source of income and he does not earn enough to provide all the needs of his family. 

They have recently begun to build a new house, however, the money he generates from his employment is not enough for him to finish the house. Aleksandra needs a loan to finish the facade on her house before the winter time so as to improve the insulation and retain the heat inside. This loan will help Aleksandra and her family to improve their living conditions. Her goal is to finish her house and she hopes to offer her children a better life!

Aleksandra and her family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To finish the facade on her house to improve the insulation and retain the heat.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose.  She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase additional medicine, mineral water and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional medicine, mineral water and other products needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rose hopes to be able to expand, soon and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional medicine, mineral water and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rebeca Orfelinda

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 38 años de  edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos dependientes. Su casa se ubica en el caserío  CP 14 distrito de Las Lomas. Vive en casa propia con esposo que le ayuda con las tareas del campo y aportando también  ingresos al hogar. 

La actividad que desarrolla Rebeca es la crianza de animales ovinos, porcinos, crianza de aves de corral, además a la cosecha de limón ya que cuenta con parcela agrícola hace más de 5 años. Cuenta con 2 has de terreno agrícola heredados de su padre donde tiene sembrado limón. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia

Desea invertir en mantenimiento de cultivo de limón (abono, deshierbo, fertilizantes, etc.) y compra de alimento balanceado para animales. Ha adquirido recientemente una mototaxi en donde también realiza el transporte de pasajeros.  Ante ello ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
Rebeca desea seguir con en el crecimiento del negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 38 years old; she is married and has five dependent children. She owns a house located in the rural community CP 14, Las Lomas district, where she lives together with her husband, who also contributes with income and helps her with the farming activities.

Rebeca raises sheep, pigs and poultry, and she also grows lime in a 2-hectares parcel of land that has belonged to her for more than five years, and which she inherited from her father. The income she obtains is used for covering her expenses and those of her family.

She would like to invest in compost, herbicide and fertilizers for the maintenance of her lime trees and in balanced food for her animals. She has recently acquired a mototaxi in which she transports people. She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa.

Rebeca wants to continue expanding her business and in this way, to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for her animals and to buy compost and fertilizers for her lime trees.

loans.name: Guigomahuton Group

texts.fr: GUIGOMAHUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Nonfohoun (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leur charge. Nonfohoun et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Nonfohoun n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a une dizaine d’année que Nonfohoun mène comme activité la vente de pains dans son quartier. Nonfohoun exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Nonfohoun s’approvisionne dans son quartier. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Nonfohoun sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe GUIGOMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Guigomahuton is a group of three people, all of whom live in the same neighborhood. 

The representative of the group, Nonfohoun (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 39 years old and married. She and her husband have 3 children, who all have been to school. Two of the children are still under their care. Nonfohoun and her husband live with their children, and together they provide for their different household needs. Nonfohoun did not go to school.

For about 10 years now, Nonfohoun has been buying and selling bread in her area. She does this work passionately, which allows her to support her and her children's needs.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Nonfohoun is asking for this fourth loan with the other members of the Guigomahuton group. This loan will help them better respond to the demands of their customers and earn more profits. Their previous loans have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her general store

loans.name: Genelie

texts.en:
Genelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling corn in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of corn to sell.

Genelie has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming rice and corn and from her general store (sari-sari store).

Genelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of corn to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
This is Mira. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her general store (sari-sari store). Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education as well as her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profit from the store will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mira hopes her business will grow into a grocery store in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all the hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is aged 48. He is married with three children, they all attend schools. He has been a maize farmer for 18 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. He plans to use the profits to make savings and pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her Xerox machine. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan for 17,000 PHP to buy more stocks of school supplies and for the maintenance of her Xerox machine. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evangeline dreams of having a successful business over the years. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional school supplies and other merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to use in making viands.

loans.name: Mwanasidi

texts.en: Mwanasidi is an old entrepreneur who lives in Msambweni, a town in the Kenyan coast. Here she set up a store over ten years ago and very much enjoys the business and being able to make her money to support her family. In her store she sells essential items such as rice, sugar, grains, noodles, etc. She hopes to receive the loan because she wants to buy more products such as sugar, tea leaves, beans, flour, among others, to increase sales so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products such as sugar, tea leaves, beans, flour, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Ablah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Ablah prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her daughter.

Ablah is a 48 year old married female from Madaba in Jordan. She has eight children, and requested a 300 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ljiljana

texts.en:
Liljana is married and lives with her husband in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. Liljana is a housewife and her husband receives a social pension. Currently they live in a house which is in need of renovation. 

Due to the high cost of electricity, they want to façade their house in order to save costs on heating in the winter. Liljana is requesting a loan to pay to façade her house. This loan will help improve their living conditions and save them money on utility costs. She hopes by doing this they will be able to save some of the money from her husbands social pension to ensure financial security.

In the near future she is hoping to have children.

Liljana is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To façade her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a hardworking man with simple hopes in life. Along with his family, he dreams of sustaining his fruit and vegetable store that is situated near his house in Agsu.

Now, through his second loan, he is requesting an amount of 1500 AZN. With it, he plans to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables and other items people can purchase in his store. By increasing the capital investment in his business, he is hopeful that he can earn more profits, which will be used to support the daily needs of his family and to improve their lifestyle little by little. 

Ramil is married and is a lovely father of two school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Safa'a

texts.en:
Safa'a is a 27 year old married woman from Madaba Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy cleaning products to resell in the same area, and she also wants to expand her project. In the future she hopes to increase her products. 

Since Safa'a is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu sells fish at the market, a business in which she has an experience of over five years. She is in her early 50's and despite her advanced age, her efforts are indispensable to the well-being of her family. She is well known in her community for her hard work and kind nature alongside her excellent services she offers her regular customers.

The major challenge she currently faces is that she foes not have preservation equipment. She is asking for this loan so as to buy a stock of fish, cooking oil, and a bigger frying pan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish, cooking oil, and a bigger frying pan.

loans.name: Minire

texts.en:
Minire is a very hard working woman from Kosovo currently living in the Roma community. She is married and is the mother of two children. For more than two years, she has made a living through collecting paper packaging and plastics and then selling them for recycling. Her husband works in manual labor as a helper. When people need to move things, they hire and pay him to do it. 

Minire is requesting a loan in order to change the windows and doors in their home. Since the house is very old, renovation such replacing these items will improve the living conditions of Minire and her family, especially with the upcoming winter season. 

Minire is hoping that in the near future she will have more products to collect and sell. Her goal is to generate more income and make a better life for her family, including providing a better education for her children. 

She thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to change her home's windows and doors.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Samar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Samar is a 37-year-old married woman who has four family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and some household items. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Wilma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en:
Annonciatha is 39 years old. She is a widow with four children who all go to school. She has been a maize farmer for 10 years. She wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals for her husband's animals selling business.

loans.name: Basmah

texts.en: Basmah is a 32-year-old, single woman from Al Khaledieh in Jordan. She has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for raw materials needed for emroidery- and straw-work. Basmah is planning to expand her project and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for embroidery supplies

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: ESPOIR est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Justine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à Marcellin, un mécanicien. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé, et à leur charge. Justine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une quinzaine d’année que Justine mène comme activité la vente des fruits dans son quartier. Justine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché et dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Justine sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ESPOIR. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
ESPOIR is a group of three people who all live in the same neighbourhood. The representative of the group, Justine (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 25 years old and is married to Marcellin - a mechanic. They have one child, who attends school and lives with them. Justine and her husband cover the household expenses between them. Justine did not go to school. For the last fifteen or so years, she has worked as a local fruit trader. She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her own needs and also those of her children.
She buys her products in a market in an area of Bénin. To meet customer demand, she is seeking a third loan, together with the members of the ESPOIR group. This loan will help them to better meet their customers' expectations and to make larger profits. The previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 41-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has been working in the bread business since ten years ago. In 2010, he opened his own bakery to improve his living and increase his income.

Fadi applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business raw materials such as flour and oil, and also necessary needs to save for the coming cold winter season. He will also invest part of the loan to pay for his children’s tuition fees.

Fadi believes that education is very important for his children's future. That's why he will put so much effort into making sure that they will get the education he hopes to provide them.

Fadi hopes to keep on improving and expanding his business as much as he can to keep on improving his family's living.

loans.use: to increase his business raw materials such as flour and oil and also necessary needs to save for the coming cold winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Ayitcheme 1 Group

texts.fr: AYITCHEME 1 est un groupement de dix sept personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Kèmi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Richard. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Kèmi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Kèmi a très peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de six ans que Kèmi mène comme activité la vente de condiments et de charbon de bois de façon secondaire à son domicile. Kèmi exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Kèmi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Kèmisollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupement AYITCHEME 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
AYITCHEME 1 is a group of seventeen people, who all live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, Kémi (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 31 years old and is married to a man named Richard. They have two children, both in school and living with them at home. The couple cover the child related expenses between them. Kèmi hardly went to school herself. For nearly six years, she has been a trader of condiments and to a lesser extent of charcoal, based at her home. Kèmi is passionate about this business, which allows her to cover her own expenses and those of her children. She buys her products at a market in Bénin. 
In order to satisfy customer demand, she is seeking a first loan together with the other members of the AYITCHEME 1 group. This loan will allow them to meet the demand from their customers and also to generate more profit for themselves.

loans.use: to buy condiments and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
Maytham is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 27 years old, and married with one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Maytham owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2006 and now he has one employee. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2,400 as a Youth Loan to buy a generator and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en:
Waad is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.

Waad owns a shop where he sells household appliances. He established his own business in 2008. He is experienced in this field and has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a loan of $1800 to paint the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to paint the shop

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is aged 44. She is married with six children; four of them go to school. She has been a maize farmer for ten years. She wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas is 49 years old. He is married and they have seven children that all attend schools. He has been a maize farmer for 14 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Modelia

texts.en:
Modelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials and equipment for her blacksmith business. Modelia has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Modelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
Este comité del barrio San Ramon esta integrado por 15 señoras que tienen el deseo de superación, por ese motivo se han reunido como grupo y luchan siempre por salir adelante.
Lidia, una de las integrantes, cuenta que vende todo tipo de prendas, y está saliendo adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y su lucha. Es una persona que no teme trabajar y luchar por sus metas para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtirse de nuevas prendas de verano, ya que estamos entrando en esa estación y quiere poder tener una buena variedad.
texts.en:
This communal bank from the San Ramon neighborhood is comprised of 15 women who have the desire to succeed.  That is the reason they have joined together as a group and struggle every day to get ahead.

Lidia is one of the members.  She says that she sells all types of clothes.  She is getting ahead by means of her effort and tenaciousness.  She is a person who is not afraid to work, and she struggles towards her goals in order to help her family.

She is requesting the loan to be able to stock up with new clothes for summers.  We are entering this season, and she wants to be able to have a good variety.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Alegres es de la ciudad de Encarnación, gracias al trabajo que ellas han hecho están ya en su tercer ciclo. Ellas se unieron ya que han visto una buena oportunidad de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Juana, ella tiene 2 hijos,  está casada con el Sr. Patrocinio y ella se dedica  a la lavandería, ambos se ayudan mutuamente y de esa forma dan a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Juana es una mujer muy decidida y le gusta mucho lo que hace.
Cuenta la Sra. Juana que el crédito que solicita a la Fundación lo utilizará para la compra de insumos y productos de limpieza, como jabones, suavizantes, aromatizantes y demás. Todas las integrantes agradecen por la gran oportunidad que están recibiendo, porque mediante esto podrán ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Alegres (Happy Women) communal bank is from the city of Encarnación.  Thanks to the work that they have done, they are in their third cycle.  They got together because they saw a good opportunity to get ahead and help their families.

Juana is one of the members of the group.  She has two children, and she is married to Patrocinio.  She is a laundress, and they mutually help each other to give the family everything it needs.

Juana is a very determined woman, and she likes what she does.

Juana says that she will use the loan she is requesting from the Fundación to buy supplies and cleaning products like soaps, softeners, deodorizers, and others.  

All of the members are grateful for the great opportunity that they are receiving through which the will be able to help their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies and cleaning products like soaps, softeners, deodorizers, and others.

loans.name: Amenah

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Amenah prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband. Amenah is a 52-year-old married woman who has four family members from Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to repaint her home and to do maintenance on her home. She hopes in the future to add another room to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor una agricultor de 33 años, soltero actualmente tiene a su cargo a dos motivos de vida que son sus hijos Emilia de un año y Carlos de 12. Muy laborioso vive en una casa hecha con madera que el mismo construyo con ayuda de sus vecinos. Desde que nació vive en su comunidad cuyo legado le permite autodenominarse fundador, pues es uno de los pioneros de la zona así como la actividad que desempeña que es la producción de café siendo uno de los productores también líderes. 
Desde pequeño se desempeña en el campo y posteriormente en parcelas que le fueron cedidos por sus padres a temprana edad, desde ese entonces con la ayuda de jornaleros logró consolidarse en solo unos años.
En las últimas temporadas el café sufrió cierto déficit en cuanto al precio y esto lo preocupa un poco, pero a lo largo de sus vida  comenta es normal que estas cosas sucedan de vez en cuando.
Al iniciarse la temporada de siembra logro rentar una parcela en la cual tiene pensado producir cacao a base de abono orgánico como es de su preferencia ya que es la mejor manera de contrarrestar el bajo precio del café, por tanto  será necesario contar con semillas, mano de obra por parte de jornaleros y la adquisición de nuevas herramientas con lo cual planea hacer el trabajo mas fluido, pues también planea a futuro adquirir dicho terreno. Este es su tercer crédito y esta dispuesto a cumplir con sus pagos de manera puntual ya que en adelante planea solicitar otro crédito. Es siempre muy participativo en su banco comunal.
Con los 2,000 comprará almácigos de cacao, abono orgánico y herramientas así mismo contactara a jornaleros para que ayuden en la actividad.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 33-year-old farmer; he is single and he is currently responsible for two of his reasons for living, who are his children, one-year-old Emilia and twelve-year-old Carlos.  He lives a hardworking life in the wooden house he built himself with the help of his neighbors.  He has lived in his community since he was born and because of his legacy there he refers to himself as one of its founders, as he was one of the area's pioneers.  He is also one of the leading producers in his field, which is growing coffee.

He has been working in the fields since he was a child and, later, on the plots that his parents left to him at an early age.  With the help of workers, he became successful only a few years afterward.  

The past few seasons coffee has suffered a shortfall in terms of price and this worries him a bit, but he tells us that throughout his life he has seen these things happen every once in a while and it is normal.

When planting season started, he was able to rent a plot of land where he plans to grow cacao with organic fertilizer, which is what he prefers, as it is the best way to offset the the low price of coffee.  As such, he will need to pay for seeds, labor in the form of workers, and the acquisition of new tools with which he plans to make his work smoother, as he also plans to purchase this land in the future.  This is his third loan and he is prepared to make his payments on time, as he plans to ask for another loan in the future.  He is always a very active participant in his communal bank.

With the 2,000 he will buy cacao seedbeds, organic fertilizer, and tools, and he will also hire laborers to help him with the work.

loans.use: to buy cacao seedbeds, organic fertilizer, and tools

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas está en su tercer ciclo y una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Flora, quien, está casada con el Sr. Gregorio y con quien tiene 4 hijos.
Ella es ama de casa y cría de aves, y también trabaja de empleada doméstica. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que da todo de si para poder ayudar a sus hijos y también a su marido con los gastos de la casa.
Flora solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y de balanceados, para poder seguir con uno de sus trabajos. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas del grupo están saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas is in its third loan cycle and one of these women is Flora, who is married to Gregorio, with whom she has four children.

She is a housewife and she raises birds and she also works as a housekeeper.  She is a very selfless woman who gives her all to be able to help her children and her husband with the household expenses.

Flora is asking for this loan to buy chickens and feed so she can continue with one of her jobs.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she and her friends from her group have received, which has helped them get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene 62  años, está casada, ella es comerciante, tiene una distribuidora y venta de electrodomésticos en su casa. Su marido de dedica a la plantación de soja y otras semillas y así ambos están saliendo adelante y se ayudan.
Francisca está muy contenta, ya que la fundación la ha ayudado grandemente en todos sus sueños. Ella desea seguir trabajando y así crecer en sus negocios.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos, con lo cual podrá tener una mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is 62 years old; she is a married businesswoman whose business is distributing and selling domestic appliances from her home.  Her husband grows soy and other seeds for a living and together they are getting ahead and helping each other.

Francisca is very happy because the foundation has helped her a great deal in achieving all of her dreams.  She wants to keep working and thereby grow her businesses.

She is asking for this loan to buy domestic appliances, which will allow her to have a greater variety of products on offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh, 30, lives in West Point with her husband and son. Her son is four years old and is currently in school. She has been involved in this business for the past five years. She sells raw fish in the community market. She received 3,500.00 LD (Liberian dollars) from her husband to start this business. She learned to sell from her mother. One difficulty she faces is the unstable prices in the market. She makes a profit when she sells. With the profit, she helps with the expenses of the home and repays her loan. She is requesting her fourth loan to purchase more cartons of fish to increase her sales.  Her dreams for the future are to buy land and build her house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cartoons of fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery selling business

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is married with six children. She is 47 years old. She has been a maize farmer for 20 years. She wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. She plans to pay school fees for her children in schools. The photo was taken at the place they normally use to meet not at her farm. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Radiya

texts.en:
Radiya is from Iraq. She is 42 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is employed and she helps him with the family income.
She is a seamstress. She always wanted to have her own tailoring project and in 2009 she opened her small business in her house. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting $3000 loan to buy a sewing machine and to decorate the room where she works. She is aiming to grow this business and increase its profits so she will be able to provide her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to decorate the room where she works.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for chairs, tables and inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. He is the only provider for the family. 

Ali owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2007 and now  has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. 

He is requesting a $1500 loan to install a rolling shutter for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter for the shop

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
21 ciclos ya han estado juntas las miembros de este grupo que lleva por nombre amanecer. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que desean salir adelante y luchar, todo esto por su familia.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Laura, ella tiene una despensa en su casa, y cuenta que trabaja ahí desde muy tempranas horas del día. Es una persona que se esmera mucho en lo que hace y es gracias a esto que está saliendo adelante. Su deseo es poder tener el día de mañana una gran despensa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas, verduras, carne, bebidas, pan y demás insumos para poder surtirse y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the Amanecer Group have been together for 21 loan cycles now.  They are hardworking, enterprising women who want to get ahead and keep fighting, all for their families.

One of the group members is Laura.  She has a small grocery store in her home and she tells us that she starts working very early in the morning.  She is a person who puts a lot of effort into what she does and it is thanks to that that she is getting ahead.  Her wish is to be able to have a big grocery store in the future.

She is asking for this loan to buy fruits, vegetables, meat, drinks, bread, and other supplies to stock up and keep offering her customers a nice variety.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, meat, drinks, bread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha continues to operate her food stall that has provided her with good results. She is one of the few old women who believe in success despite advanced age. Mwanasha is grateful for the support she got and which she will be receiving, as she is sure that the loan she is requesting will be of great help to her. With this new loan, she will be able to buy utensils and other ingredients like flour and sugar among others. Her dream is to own a hotel [restaurant] sometime.

loans.use: to buy utensils and other ingredients like flour and sugar among others.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Catalina”,  está en el Cuarto Ciclo con 18 integrantes, gracias a que todas ellas están trabajando arduamente están saliendo adelante y con este trabajo ayudan a sus familiares.
Juliana es una persona muy trabajadora y lucha siempre por salir adelante y dar todo a su familia. Ella vende helados y jugos, en lo cual le va muy bien, y tiene buena clientela, es en esta época que tiene más venta y le va mucho mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de helados de todos los sabores, y así tener bien abastecido su local para poder seguir dando a sus clientes lo que quieren.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina communal bank, with 18 members, is in its fourth cycle.  This is thanks to the fact that all of them are working arduously.  They are getting ahead, and with this work they are helping their families.

Juliana is a very hard-working person, and she always struggles to get ahead and give everything to her family.  She sells ice-cream and juices.  It is going very well for her, and she has good clientele.  During this season she has more sales, it is going even better.

She is requesting the loan to buy all flavors of ice cream.  This way her place will be well stocked, and she will be able to continue giving her customers what they want.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Nohelia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Nohelia, ella pertenece al banco “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es joven madre de una niña de  en edad escolar además de ser una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la preparación y venta de jugos de frutas en un puesto de un mercado de la ciudad, Nohelia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como miel de abejas, frutas variadas y azúcar, que le permitan producir sus jugos.
Nohelia trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para darle a su única hija una mejor vida, y lo que es más importante, brindarle una mejor educación.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y  una mejor educación a su hija.
texts.en:
This group member is Nohelia.  She belongs to the Luz del Sur Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is the young mother of a school-age little girl, as well as being a very hardworking woman.  She is still making and selling fruit juices from a stand in the city's market.  Nohelia is asking for a loan this time to buy supplies such as honey, different fruits, and sugar, which will allow her to make her juices.

Nohelia works a lot and makes sacrifices to give her only daughter a better life and, most importantly, to give her a better education.

She is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and to give her daughter a better education.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as honey, different fruits, and sugar

loans.name: Ysela

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Ysela, ella pertenece al banco “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de un niña de  en edad escolar además de ser una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la preparación y venta de jugos de frutas en el puesto de un mercado de la ciudad, Ysela en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar utencilios como vasos e insumos como miel de abejas, frutas variadas y azúcar, que le permitan producir sus jugos.
Ysela trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para darle a su único hijo una mejor vida, y lo que es más importante, brindarle una mejor educación.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y  una mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ysela is a member of the communal bank "Luz del Sur," in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is a young mother of a school-aged child.  She is also a very hardworking woman.  She is continuing with her business making and selling fruit juices at a stall in a market in the city.  At this time, Ysela is requesting a loan to buy utensils such as cups and supplies such as honey, a variety of fruit, and sugar, which she needs to make her juices.

Ysela works hard and sacrifices herself in order to give her only child a better life and, most importantly, to provide him with a better education.  She is very grateful to Kiva for giving her the means to provide her family with a better quality of life and her child with a better education.

loans.use: to buy utensils and supplies for her business making fruit juices

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 33 years old. Her husband works as a teacher at a primary school. They have seven children; five of them go to school. Marie Louise has been a maize farmer for 12 years. She wants a Kiva loan for fertilizers and seed multiplication, and to support labor costs. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children. (The photo was taken at the meeting place; not at her farm.)

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has five children. He is the only provider for the family.

Ahmad owns a small store for a water purification service. He established his business in 2009 and now he has an employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. 

Ahmad is requesting $2400 as a loan to buy a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions and provide a good education for his kids.

loans.use: to buy a generator for a water purification service

loans.name: Bosmonkul

texts.ru: Босмонкулу  42 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 19  лет он занимается скотоводством и земледелием.  В основном он выращивает пшеницу, ячмень виноград и откорм скота. Он имеет МРС, т.е. козы и бараны. Бостмонкул хочет развивать свой бизнес и поэтому запрашивает займ на сумму  6000  сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bosmonkul is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. The climate of the area where he lives is conducive to growing crops and raising livestock, and for the last 19 years, Bosmonkul has been farming and engaged in animal husbandry. He mainly grows wheat, barley, grapes, and livestock feed, and he raises goats and sheep. Bosmonkul wants to develop his business, so he is asking for a loan of 6,000 Tajikistan Somoni to purchase livestock. He is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем. У нее есть взрослые дети. Светлана имеет свой собственный бизнес.

Светлана занимается торговлей женской спортивной одежды на рынке. Ее опыт работы 16 лет. Светлана  продает качественный и ходовой товар. У нее есть постоянные клиенты. В бизнес план Светланы входит постройка бутика.

Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 21000 гривен на закупку теплой спортивной одежды: кофты, костюмы и брюки. Часть кредита она вложит в строительства бутика.  Кредит поможет увеличить доход Светланы, и тем самым улучшить быт ее семьи.
texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has adult children. She owns her own business. She sells women's sportswear at the market. Her goods are high-quality and trendy, and she has built a regular clientele. Svetlana's business plan includes the construction of a boutique. 

Svetlana is seeking a loan of 21,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia. Part of this sum will be used to buy warm sportswear, such as sweaters, tracksuits, and pants, and part will be put towards building the boutique. This loan will help Svetlana increase her income, thereby improving the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to stock up on winter sportswear

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Vicentina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa con su actividad, atendiendo en su salón de belleza, donde realiza tratamientos de belleza diversos. Vicentina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como acondicionadores, shampoo, tintes, y cosméticos.
Vicentina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecerse en su actividad económica y con la educación de su hija mayor quien esta en edad escolar.
texts.en: Vicentina is a member of the communal bank "Luz del Sur," located in Cusco, Peru. She continues working in her salon, which offers many different beauty treatments. Vicentina is requesting this loan in order to buy beauty products such as conditioner, shampoo, dyes, and cosmetics. She is very thankful for Kiva for helping her to strengthen her business, which allows her to pay for the educational expenses of her oldest daughter, who is now in school.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as conditioner, shampoo, dyes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана живет в небольшом городке и имеет свой бизнес. Она покупает молоко у односельчан оптом и производит молочные продукты - творог и сметану, которые продает на рынке. 

Светлана намерена расширять свой бизнес и увеличивать объем продаж. Она просит предоставить ей кредит для покупки холодильника и морозильной камеры, которые позволят ей покупать больше сырья и хранить больше продукции. 

Светлана строит дом, а также собирает деньги для дочери, которая в этом году оканчивает школу и собирается поступать в колледж.
texts.en:
Svetlana lives in a small town and runs her own business. She buys milk in bulk from her neighbors and makes dairy products - cottage cheese and sour cream, which she sells at the market.
Svetlana plans to expand her business and increase her sales. She is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator and a freezer, which will allow her to buy more milk and store more dairy products.
Svetlana is building a house and saving money for her daughter, who is going to graduate from high school and go to college this year.

loans.use: to buy appliances for storing milk and dairy products

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat is from Jarash, Jordan. She is a 22 year old married woman with 2 family members. Ayat is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for some home improvements. She wants to do kitchen maintenance and buy some household items. In the future she hopes to create a comfortable space for her family. Since Ayat is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна использовала предыдущий кредит на закупку продуктов для продажи - масла и сыра. На полученную прибыль смогла приобрести холодильное оборудование для бизнеса. Татьяна трудолюбива и напориста. Она намерена расширять свой бизнес дальше. 

В этот раз Татьяна просит предоставить ей 7,000 гривен на закупку товара. Она уверена, что широкий ассортимент и маленькая наценка - главные факторы для успеха в ее бизнесе.
texts.en:
Tatyana use her previous loan to buy products for resale, such as butter and cheese. She was able to purchase coolers for her business with the resulting profits. Tatyana is hard-working and tenacious. She plans to expand her business further.
This time Tatyana is asking for 7,000 UAH to purchase goods. She is confident that a wide product variety and a small markup are key factors in the success of her business.

loans.use: to increase product variety

loans.name: Majedah

texts.en:
Majedah is a 42-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan, who has three family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to buy various products such as accessories, clothes and cosmetic products to resell in her home. She would like to expand her business by increasing her products. She hopes to open a shop and to buy a home in the future. 

For cultural reasons, Majedah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her brother.

loans.use: to buy various products such as accessories, clothes and cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана в разводе. У нее двое детей. Светлана продает цифровую технику.

Вместе с мужем на протяжении 10 лет Светлана вела бизнес. Они сначала арендовали помещение, но после у них появилась возможность купить достаточно большой  магазин. Бизнес шел вверх. Но год назад из-за измен мужа Светлана развелась с ним. Муж отобрал у нее магазин. И Светлана начала все заново.
 
Сейчас Светлана арендует новое помещение  и занимается продажей цифровой техники самостоятельно. Она хочет насытить магазин товаром, чтобы удовлетворить спрос покупателей. Светлана трудолюбива и ставит пред собой большие цели.

Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 22000 гривен на закупку ноутбуков и телефонов. Дополнительную прибыль она потратить на увеличение ассортимента товара и улучшение торгового места.
texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced and has two children. She sells electronic products. For 10 years, Svetlana and her husband ran a business together. Initially, they rented their premises but later got the opportunity to buy quite a big store, and their business took off. However, a year ago, Svetlana divorced her husband because of his infidelity, and he took the store from her. 

Svetlana has now started over. She is renting new premises and sells electronics independently. She wants to stock her shop with goods in order to meet the demands of her customers. She is hard-working and has set herself big goals. Svetlana is asking for a loan of 22,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to buy notebook computers and telephones. She will use the income generated to increase the range of goods she sells and to improve her sales outlet.

loans.use: to buy computers and mobile phones

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en: Rasha is a 24 year old married woman from Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy women’s and children’s clothes to resell. In the future she hopes to increase her inventory and her family’s income. Since Rasha is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина продает женскую одежду на рынке в Белой Церкви. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже более 10 лет. Галина ответственная и целеустремленная женщина. Она всегда во время выплачивает кредиты и расчитывается по счетам. 

Галина просит предоставить ей 4,000 гривен на увеличение ассортимента осенней одежды. С наступлением похолодания увеличилась активность клиентов и ей нужно закупить дополнительный товар, чтобы восполнять спрос.
texts.en:
Galina sells women's clothing at a market in Belaya Tserkov. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. Galina is a responsible and determined woman. She always pays back her loans and pays her bills.
Galina is asking for a loan of 4,000 UAH to increase her selection of fall clothes. Cooler temperatures have encouraged shopping activity, and she needs to buy additional merchandise to meet the increased demand.

loans.use: to increase her selection of fall clothing

loans.name: Sohad

texts.en: Sohad prefers that her picture not appear on the Internet for cultural reasons; thus it is her husband who appears in the above photo. Sohad is from Hay Nazal, Jordan. She is a 35 year old married woman with 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase accessories to resell in her home. In the future she hopes to expand her inventory, open a shop, and buy a home.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to resell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is employed. Ali owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2009 and now he has good experience in the field and a good reputation in his local community.

Ali is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat is married and has one son. She decided to start a new business with her husband that involved animals in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied a course about how ‘To get ahead’ at a women's organization and she got enough skills about business.  Her son will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to buy cattle to organize a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to organize a new business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki, 39, lives in her own house with her family: her husband and three children. She sells fruits and vegetables, like oranges, strawberries, bananas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and chilies among others. She’s had this business for many years and has gained a lot of experience in sales which has allowed her to make more financial gains. She has secured a clientele who prefer her products for their quality, good prices and, mostly, for her unequaled service. 

Riziki is a humble and active woman, very dedicated to her work. She’s always alert to new opportunities that can lead the way to a prosperous future. Her biggest secret in the fight to succeed is perseverance and love, which she puts into her work every day. In the last weeks, demand for her products has increased and she’d like to take advantage of this by making a new investment in her business to please her clients. That’s why she’s requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has four children. He is the only provider for the family. He owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2000 and now he has lots of experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. Mahmoud is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en: Sabha is a 58 year old widowed woman who has two family members from AL Bayader Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy materials for making bread traps to resell in the same of area. She hopes in the future to develop and expand her project. She also wants to open a bakery and to help her son in his marriage.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bread traps.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 33 years old and married. He has been earning a living in the restaurant business for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. His spouse farms to earn additional income. This will be Charles’ first loan with KADET LTD. He will use his KES 30,000 to purchase foodstuffs such as milk, rice and flour to increase his stock. His plan for the anticipated profit is to open another restaurant in Limuru town. His dream for the future is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as milk, rice and flour to increase his stock

loans.name: Candido

texts.es:
El Sr. Candido es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está casado, y tiene 4 hijos. Él es dueño de una despensa y carnicería, anexo ramos generales ya hace más de 7 años en donde trabaja con su familia.
Cuenta que por medio de su trabajo ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que ha podido y para que no les falte nada, y para que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
El crédito lo solicita el Sr.  para la terminación de su vivienda, en la cual tiene su despensa, ya que esta es una forma de seguir creciendo y de dar una buena comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Candido is from the city of Encarnación, he is married and has four children. He is the owner of a grocery and butcher shop, annexed to a general store that he has already had for seven years where he works with his family. Thanks to his job, he has been able to give his family all that he could so that they were never in need and so that his children had a good education. He is applying for a loan to finish his home, from where he also runs his grocery store and through these means continue to grow and give a comfortable dwelling to his family.

loans.use: finish his home.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma, 28, is a single lady who lives in Msambweni in the Coastal region of Kenya. She has been working hard for five years in her business selling a variety of African dishes. She sells all day and takes care of her customers as well. She is asking for her second Yehu loan of 15,000 KES to stock up on raw materials to increase her sales. She is going to buy corn flour, sugar, rice, and firewood to cook. All her efforts are in order to succeed in making her business grow in order to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, sugar, rice, and firewood to cook.

loans.name: Assatu

texts.en: Assatu, aged 27, lives at West Point with her friend, and two children. Her children are between the ages of one and nine. Only one of them is attending  school. Assatu is a college student.  For the past six years, she has been selling (imported) ladies slippers and hand bags. Because of the quality of the slippers and hand bags that she sells, she makes a profit every day. With the profit, she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her child. She also feels self reliant. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more ladies slippers and hand bags for the business.  Her dream is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more lady slippers and hand bags for the business.

loans.name: Bekim

texts.en:
Bekim is forty-three years old, married, and has three children between the ages of eight and twelve years old. All three of them go to school. He works in a heating company with a very low salary and his wife works as a babysitter. He has managed somehow to build a house for his family but the second floor is incomplete and is still missing windows and doors. 

In addition, the roof is not properly completed and it leaks whenever it rains. Bekim is requesting a loan for the first time in order to purchase the doors and windows needed for the second floor and to fix the roof. This loan will help him be able to have the necessary repairs before the winter to ensure that his family is kept dry, safe and warm. Bekim hopes to offer a better life for his children and provide them a better education. He and his family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase the doors and windows and to fix the roof.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is 41 years old and lives with her husband and their six children in a house. She runs a food stall and has been working in business for several years. She has acquired valuable experience that allows her to keep going. Thanks to the good management of her sales, she always obtains the best earnings.

The community where she lives is very busy and she already has a lot of customers, although her best clients are the neighbors. Everyone prefers her because her product is of good quality, affordable, and because the service is the fastest in the neighborhood.

Mariamu is an energetic woman: she is determined and very devoted to her work. She wishes to succeed and fulfill her dreams. That is why every day she does her very best in her work because she knows that only in this way will she achieve the success she so much hopes for. With the loan, she plans to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja 40, resides with her husband, and three children at West Point. Her children are between the ages of six and seventeen and are attending school. Her husband is a business man, and Haja received the initial capital from her husband to start this business.  For the past seven years, she has been selling gas and fuel/oil.  She loves to do this business because, she makes a profit when she sells. With the profit, she buys more gasoline and fuel/oil for the business and with the profit she contributes to her family's expenses.  She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more gasoline and fuel/oil for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline and fuel/oil for the business.

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en: Bahruz is 29 years old and married with two children. He began his business 13 years ago, which consisted of a small barbershop where services were offered to the residents of the area. Today he has his own clientele. Thanks to the help and money that he has applied, he will be able to make improvements to his home. He wants to plaster and paint the kitchen and to purchase necessary installations to his bathroom. This way he will provide for the security and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To purchase necessary installation to make repairs at the kitchen and bathroom of his house.

loans.name: Atraf Group

texts.en:
This group is Atraf who lives in Taiz, Yemen. They are six ladies who took out a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB.
Ashraq is a 30 year old hard working woman. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She has six children and almost all of them are studying in private school. For five years, she herself has been selling potatoes and ice cream to a more variety of clients. 

She has requested a youth loan of 50000 YER from AMB to purchase potatoes and ice cream for her business. With the profit amount, she is interested in opening a new shop and improving her living conditions. She hopes for a bright future for her children.
