loans.use: to purchase potatoes and ice cream for her business.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia del Carmen  posee un negocio de venta de ropa en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia.

La señora Ofelia se traslada a su puesto de trabajo desde las 5:00 am. Para exhibir sus productos como sabanas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, colchas, camisas de varón y mujer a todos sus clientes que llegan de los barrios y comunidades aledaña, viaja dos veces por semana a la ciudad de Managua a comprar su mercadería.

 Actualmente está solicitando un crédito, el cual invertirá directamente en la compra de ropa interior, ropa para bebe, camisetas, sabanas, colchas. Al obtener dicho crédito espera mejorar sus ganancias y  surtir su negocio con productos variados de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida propia y la de su familia.

La señora Ofelia del Carmen  está muy agradecida con Ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio y poder salir adelante con su familia brindándole una mejor educación y formación a su hija. Sus sueños son terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Ofelia del Carmen has a retail clothing business in one of the markets in the city of León. She has been doing this to take care of her family.  She arrives at her post at 5am to exhibit her products such as, sheets, women's and men's underwear, bedspreads, men's and women's shirts, to all of the customers that arrive from neighborhoods and communities in the countryside. She travels two times a week to the city of Managua to purchase her merchandise. She is currently applying for a loan, which she will directly invest in purchasing more underwear, baby clothing, t-shirts, sheets, and bedsheets. After getting the loan, she will be able to improve her earnings and stock her business with a variety of products and be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family. Mrs. Ofelia del Carmen is very grateful to Ceprodel since they have already helped her grow her business and be able to get ahead with her family, offering them a better education for her daughter. Her dream is to finish the construction on her home.

loans.use: purchase underwear, baby clothing, t-shirts, sheets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Cesar, con 31 años de edad, él pertenece al banco comunal “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Cesar continúa con su actividad económica en  la fabricación de estructuras metálicas y carpintería en general. Cesar necesita comprar materiales como varillas de acero, planchas de acero, electrodos  para soldadura y madera. para producir en su taller.
El gran sueño de Cesar es ahorrar y comprar un vehículo para transportar el material con el que trabaja y  también para el transporte de sus muebles.
 Cesar agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y mantenerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
The borrower is Cesar, 31. He belongs to the "Luz del Sur" communal bank in the city of Cuzco, Peru. Cesar is continuing with his business making metal structures and doing general carpentry. 

Cesar needs to buy materials such as steel rods, sheet steel, welding electrodes and wood, so that he can work in his shop.  Cesar's great dream is to save and buy a vehicle for transporting the material he works with, and also to transport his furniture. Cesar is grateful to Kiva for allowing him to develop himself and keep his business going.

loans.use: To buy steel rods, welding electrodres and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing farm inputs such as fertilizer, seedling and pay labor.

loans.name: Donato Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Donato  tiene 41 años y es casado con 3 hijos que tienen las edades de 10, 17 y 26 años, el se dedica a la carpintería, el realiza todo tipo de trabajos desde la fabricación de muebles y arreglos de todo tipo de muebles, el se dedica a esta actividad  desde hace ya 20 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero su carpintería se encuentra en la zona de Pampahasi este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Donato utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de  madera por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo,  El Sr. Donato  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, su deseo es ser uno de los mejores carpinteros y así de esta manera mejorar la venta y por ende sus ganancias, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Donato is 41 years old, he is married and has 3 children who are 10, 17 and 26 years old. He is a carpenter and he does his work in a furniture factory and he also repairs all types of furniture. He has been doing this work for 20 years, which he learned from his father, who was also a carpenter in his own carpentry center that is located in the zone of Pampahasi. This is his first loan in his first sequence with this institution and Mr. Donato will use the loan to purchase more quality wood. His reason for applying for the loan is the lack of capital to purchase the material he needs to work. Mr. Donato is presented with challenges  in his business and to lift himself out of poverty he is going to use the benefits to improve his quality of life and that of his family. His desire is to be one of the best carpenters and be able to improve his sales with the goal of more income since this is his only activity that allows his to support himself and his family, for this reason his motivation is to be happy and he is already grateful to this institution for the support they are offering him.

loans.use: purchase wood.

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim is a kind and hardworking person. He is married and has two children, ages 25 and 30. For 20 years, Nazim has worked with his wife and son. They are selling meat, wool and cheese from the yard of their house. Nazim has an area where he pastures the animals and a stone barn to keep them, but his financial condition doesn't allow him to buy more sheep to develop his livestock business. That's why he has applied for this loan to purchase several sheep and resell them during the high season after fattening them. He also plans to make a wedding for his son after the improvement of his business.

loans.use: to purchase several sheep to resell after fattening.

loans.name: Rubia Carolina

texts.es:
Rubia, necesita comprar insumos agropecuarios para su cultivo de granos básicos, por eso que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de seis sacos de abono y pagar mano de obra, esto le ayudara a mantener el cultivo en buenas condiciones, dandole los insumos necesarios para fortalecer la plantacion.
Ella comenta que con el préstamo anterior pudo aumentar la producción de granos básicos, ademas que ahora existe un nuevo miembro en la familia y se encuentran mejor económicamente gracias al crédito anteriormente recibido.
texts.en: Rubia needs to purchase agricultural supplies for her cultivation of basic grains and for this reason she is applying for a new loan to purchase six sacks of fertilizer and pay for labor, this will help her to continue to cultivate in good conditions, giving her the income she needs to strengthen the plantation. She comments that with previous loan she was able to increase production of basic grains, also there is now  new member of the family and she finds herself in a better economic situation thanks to the previous loan she already received.

loans.use: purchase six sacks of fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old, married to Joyce, and together they are blessed with three children. He has been earning a living through providing veterinary services and farming for the past six years. He earns a monthly income of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be his first loan with KADET Ltd of 30,000 KES. He plans to use it for purchasing more stock of vaccines and drugs to improve the services he offers his customers. His plan for the anticipated profit is to open a veterinary shop. His dream and hope for the future is to become a successful officer.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and drugs for a veterinary service.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is an old mother who has been selling mangrove trees for over seven years. She is over 50 years old and she is a visionary woman. She has seven grown children, one of whom helps her to operate the business. In addition to this business, she sells fish from her home, mostly during the evening hours. 

Construction has been rampant for the past few months and demand for trees has risen. Asha is therefore asking for a loan from Yehu to buy more mangrove trees to sell.

loans.use: to buy more mangrove trees to sell.

loans.name: Louise E

texts.en:
Louise, 28, is the mother of three children.  She is married and lives at West Point. She stopped her education in the 12th grade. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 8 and are in school. Her husband is a businessman.  He gave her the initial capital to start in her business. She has had this business for the past four years. She sells mineral water, sardines, soft drinks, hair grease, biscuits and many other items.

With the profit that she generates from the business she buys more goods, pays back her loan and assists her husband with the expenditures of the family. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more soft drinks, hair grease, biscuits and sardines for the business.  Her dream is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, hair grease, biscuits and sardines for the business

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 38 years old and he is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years.

He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, for seed multiplication and to support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business of farming. The photo was taken at the place they normally use to meet and not at his farm.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 28 years old, married to Richard and blessed with two children aged three and one year respectively. She owns a cosmetic shop, a business she started eight months ago, and earns a monthly income of 28,000 KES. 

She wants to purchase body creams, lipsticks, nail polish, hair braids and weaves and has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES for this purpose. 

Her profit will be ploughed back into her business. She dreams of seeing this business expand as well as living a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase body creams, lipsticks, nail polish, hair braids and weaves

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 30 years old, married to Julius and blessed with three children aged 10, eight and six years respectively.  She owns rental rooms that she has let out as a hostel, a business she has been in for seven years now and earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES from rent. 

She has requested her first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase beds for furnishing the hostel. The profit she earns will aid her to build more rooms. 

Her dream is to see her children get the best education.

loans.use: to purchase beds for furnishing the hostel

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 48 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have six children all enrolled in school. He has been a maize farmer for 25 years. He would like a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to help the poor neighboring area.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Vlora

texts.en:
Vlora is 27 years old and single. She lives in the village with her entire family. There are eight people that live in the house together: Vlora, her four sisters, one brother, mother and father. Until now the family mainly got their income from only her father who works in a flour factory and they earned some additional income from selling vegetables they grow. 

Vlora is a very hard worker, ambitious, and full of a lot of ideas for business. Two weeks ago she stared a handicraft business with her four sisters. 
People in the community are able to order handicrafts and the girls make the individual items. Every week they earn around 150 Euros from this business. This business is appealing as it is special and unique, producing crafts and gifts that cannot be found elsewhere in the market. Although they are just beginning their business, the demands and customers are many and growing. Vlora is requesting a loan in order to buy materials for her handicrafts in order to meet the customer needs.

She hopes that after a year she will be able to expand her business network with other girls in her village. Her goal is to improve the living conditions and quality of life for her family.  

She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy materials for handicrafts

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and one goes to school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates a liquor store from home. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 2,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more of local Gin. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start going to villages of Kasese for local Gin and also to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more local Gin

loans.name: Vahide

texts.en:
Vahide is married and has two grown children, ages 20 and 23 years old. She is a widow; her husband passed away many years ago. 

To earn a living and pay for the education of her children, Vahide has worked making and selling handicrafts for more than ten years. 
She really had to work hard to support and raise her children as a widow alone. At the beginning, she started to sell her work in her neighborhood, and now she has managed to expand her selling to also include the city. 

Vahide is requesting a loan to buy material for her work and to improve the conditions for her workroom. This loan will help her to increase her handicraft products. 

In the future, she hopes to open her own shop where she can sell her items and thereby secure a better income and future for her family. 

She is very thankfull to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy material for her work and improve the conditions for her workroom.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Elena, ella pertenece al banco comunal “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia continúa con realizando su actividad económica principal que es el comercio de productos variados como ropa, calzados, regalos etc. en un bazar que ella tiene en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad. Elena en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería, para capitalizar su bazar ya que esta próxima la campaña navideña.
Elena está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
This is Elena. She belongs to the communal back “Luz del Sur” in the city of Cusco, Peru. Elena continues her main economic activity, which is the sale of various products such as clothing, footwear, gifts, etc. in a shop that she has in one of the principle markets of the city. Elena in this opportunity needs the loan to buy merchandise to capitalize her store since it is almost the Christmas season.

Elena is very thankful to Kiva for permitting her to strengthen her economic activity.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, and gifts in general for her shop.

loans.name: Verónica Sarai

texts.es:
Verónica, necesita surtir su negocio, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz, arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijol, café, galletas y más, esto le ayudara a poder incrementar el inventario de su negocio, ademas le dara mas seguridad para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior compro productos para mejorarles las ofertas a sus clientes y eso le ayudo a generar más ganancias económicas, ella sigue con su negocio y a logrado tener una buena estabilidad en su familia colaborando con sus padres.
texts.en:
Veronica needs to supply her business, and therefore is applying for a lona to buy corn, rice, sugar, oil, beans, coffee, cookies, and more. This will help her be able to increase her store’s inventory. Furthermore, it will give her more security to be able to meet her customers’ demand.

She says that with the previous loan she bought products to improve the offers for her customers, and that helped her generate more economic gains. She continues with her business and has been able to attain a good stability in her family with her parents’ contributions.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, sugar, oil, beans, coffee, and cookies.

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes is a 59-year-old married woman from Loon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 37 years old.

She has been in the tuba (coconut wine) vending business for 10 years. She sells tuba (coconut wine) and suka, a vinegar made from fermented coconut. She plans to use the loan to buy additional gallon containers for tuba storage, more tuba to sell, and more bottles for the suka (vinegar). 

In the future, she wants to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy gallon containers, tuba (coconut wine) and bottles for suka (vinegar).

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est une veuve âgée de 58 ans. elle a comme activité une boutique dans un marché de la ville dans laquelle elle vend des babouches et chaussures en plastiques depuis pratiquement 05 ans. elle s'approvisionne pour l'instant en détail dans le marché local et elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des ballots de babouches pour non seulement renforcer son stock de marchandise, mais également augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. elle a pour ambition d'épargner pour pour assurer la scolarité de ses petits enfants. Aussi les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux supporter les charges domestiques devenues assez lourdes depuis le décès de son époux.
texts.en:
Julienne is a 58-year-old widow. Her business is a shop in the town market where she has been selling plastic-packaged slippers and shoes for nearly five years. For the moment, she gets her supplies at retail prices in the local market and with this loan she would like to purchase packages of slippers not only to increase her stock but also to increase her profit margin.

Julienne's ambition is to save enough to ensure the education of her grandchildren. The profits will also allow her to better meet the domestic expenses that have become somewhat difficult since the death of her husband.

loans.use: To purchase packages of shoes.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: El Sra. Celestina  tiene 62 años y es casado con 1 hijo ella realiza todo tipo de trabajos en madera desde cucharas, cucharones servilleteros junto a su esposo quien le ayuda con la compra de madera y con la realización de los trabajos que la Sra. Celestina se dedica a vender, ella se dedica a esta actividad  desde hace ya 30 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien  era carpintero la Sra. Celestina utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de  madera por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo,  la Sra. Celestina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, , ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecida a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Celestina is 62 years old and is married with one child. She creates in all types of work with wood from spoons, to ladles, to napkin holders. She works with her husband who helps her purchase wood and sell Celestina’s work. Celestina has done this work for 30 years. She learned it from her father who was a carpenter. 

Celestina will use this loan to purchase wholesale wood. Her reason to request this loan is that she lacks capital to purchase the wood for work. Celestina faces challenges in her business including overcoming poverty. She is going to use the benefits to improve her quality of life and that of her family. This is the only work that will allow her to support her and her family. For this reason she is happy and grateful with the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es: La señorita Evelin continua con sus estudios en la normal en la carrera de magisterio ella es la hija mayor sigue con la misma actividad del comercio de coca que trae desde el chapare hasta el acopio donde vende por paquetes, ella tiene un permiso especial para poder comercializar la hoja de coca, le fue muy bien con el anterior credito, por este motivo esta solicitando otro credito para la compra de coca por mayor.
texts.en: Evelin continues with her studies in the teacher training college for her teaching career.  She is the eldest daughter.  She continues with the same commercial activity of the sale of coca that she brings from El Chapare to the collection place where it is sold by the packet.  She has a special permit to be able to sell coca leaf.  She did very well with the previous credit and for this reason she is requesting another loan to purchase coca wholesale.

loans.use: to buy coca wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food-making ingredients for her husband's restaurant business.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 24 years old, married and blessed with two children that she supports. She has been in the motorbike transport business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She applied for her fourth loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase motorbike spare parts and service the motorbike. 

The anticipated profits will help her expand the business and buy another motorbike. Her future plan is to construct a better house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts and service the motorbike.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en: Subira is 26 years old and a married mother with four children. She works very hard in her own business selling fuel and coconuts from her home. The major challenge that she faces is lack of enough capital to invest into her businesses. She has been in business for three years now. Subira is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can buy gallons of petrol and a sack of coconuts to sell. She hopes to increase sales. Being able to increase her sales, her customer base, and her earnings are her primary goals.

loans.use: to buy gallons of petrol and a sack of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 34 years old and married to a farmer.  They have four children between 4 and 14 years old. Three of them go to school. 

She wants a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children’s school fees. (The photo was taken at the place that farmers normally meet, not at her farm.)

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Glady

texts.en: Glady is a 38-year-old lady who lives in Buchanan with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 20. Her children are in school. For the past eight years, she has been involved in business. Presently, she is selling used clothes in the local market. A friend helped her start her business, which she earns a living from. Glady is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to build a new home for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with nine children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, soap, sugar and a carton of salt. Florence's major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked wholesale shop and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, soap, sugar and a carton of salt

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en:
Marthline is 30 years old and lives in Buchanan along with her husband and four children between the ages of 5 and 13. She has been selling cold soft drinks, biscuits, rubber tubs, buckets, candy, etc., for the past four years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold soft drinks, biscuits, rubber tubs, buckets, candy, etc., for her business. She hopes to be an owner of a house and take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cold soft drinks, biscuits, rubber tubs, buckets, candy, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old and single with no dependents. She practices dairy farming, a practice she ventured into three years ago and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She wants to purchase a dairy cow for efficient milk production that will meet the demand of her customers. She has requested a first loan of KES. 30,000. 

Her profit will be plowed back to her business. She dreams of living a stable and comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
Jose, vive con su familia, está soltero en su hogar administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, este negocio lo aprendió de sus parientes, lo atiende todos los días desde las siete de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde y tiene cuatro años de estar en el negocio.

El necesita comprarse mercadería como frijoles, azúcar, aceite, boquitas, galletas, entre otros productos que son necesarios tener sea la mano en el negocio para atender la demanda de los clientes, José solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar esta inversión y que le ayude a crecer en su inventario.

Su objetivo con el prestamo es poder realizar una buena inversión que le permita concentrar mayor variedad de productos al negocio y así atender mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family. He is single and manages a store with basic necessity products. He learned this business from his relatives. He works there every day from seven in the morning until two in the afternoon and has been working in this business for four years.

He needs ro buy merchandise such as beans, sugar, oil, snacks, cookies and more products that are necessary to have in the store to meet the customers' demands. José is asking for a loan to make thi sinvestment and help increase his inventory. 

His goal with this loan is to make a good investment that will allow hom to have a wider variety of products in his business and thus tend to his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, snacks and cookies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana con su previo credikiva compró jugos y refrescos en general además de toallas, sabanas, manteles y calzado por encargo. Con su credikiva amplió su negocio en otras líneas de productos y está satisfecha atendiendo la demanda existente. Se acerca el fin de año y su capital d etrabajo no resulta suficiente para responder a esta época en las cuales sus productos ptresentan un amyor movimiento en las ventas. Ahora planea acceder un nuevo credikiva y con el comprará refrescos y bebidas, calzado y productos domésticos que han sido solicitado por su segmento de mercado. Su inversión tendrá exito porque cuenta con clientes fijos, tradicionales que pagan muy bien y por eso a ellos le sirve con céditos, ubicando su inversión en un rango de recuperación segura. Ella dice a sus finaciadores: Como en ocasiones anteriores, agradezco la confianza en mi y pueden estar seguros que no los defraudaré."
texts.en: Ana with her previous Kiva credit purchased juice and soft drinks in addition to towels, sheets, tablecloths, and shoes to resell. With her credit she grew her business in other product lines and she is satisfying her current demand. The end of the year is coming and her working capital is not sufficient to respond to the seasonal demand for more sales and inventory turnover. She is now planning to request a new loan to buy soft drinks, shoes, and household products requested by her market segment. Her investment will be successful because she has a fixed clientele that are very faithful customers that can support her loan responsibilities. The return on this loan is a safe investment. She wants to tell her financers: “as in previous occasions, I am grateful for the trust placed in me and you can be sure I will not betray that trust.”

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, drinks, shoes and household goods.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children, who are currently in school. She earns a living running a food stall that has been active for the last six years. Thanks for the experience she has gained, she knows what her customers like.  

Mwanamkuu is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy flour, sugar, rice, meat, etc., and thus, serve more people.

Mwanamkuu is a lady who has good references from her neighbors and is very respectful and hardworking. She has a great desire to succeed and live well with her husband.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, rice, meat, etc.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is 27 years old, married, and blessed with two children that he supports.  He has operated a food stall for the last three years, making a monthly income of 12,000 KES.  Samwel has applied for his second loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD.  He plans to purchase an oven and other utensils for his food stall.  The anticipated profits will help him to open another stall.  His future plan is to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase an oven for his food stall.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel, se dedica a la venta de medicinas y también es albañil, es una persona muy responsable, vive con su esposa y tienen tres hijos, él aprendió de un amigo a realizar el negocio y tiene ya ocho años en las ventas, poco a poco ha ido incrementando este negocio con su experiencia.

Joel quiere comprarse un lote de medicinas que son necesarias en el negocio por ejemplo se comprará un lote de vitaminas, antibióticos, sueros, otra parte del crédito será utilizada en la compra de cuatro balcones para las ventanas de su hogar, este préstamo servirá para aumentar la capacidad del negocio y también le permitirá tener más segura su familia con la instalación de las ventanas.

El considera que dentro de sus aspiraciones está mejorar su vivienda para que su familia se sienta más cómoda, también quiere agregar más medicamentos al negocio, ya que esto le permite que sus clientes se inclinen a comprarle los productos y esto le ayudará a incrementar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Joel sells medicine and is also a bricklayer. He is a very responsible person. He lives with his wife and three children. He learned the business from a friend and has been selling for 8 years. Little by little he has grown this business with his experience. 

Joel wants to buy a lot of medicine necessary for his business. For example, he will buy a lot of vitamins, antibiotics, and sera. Another part of the loan will be used to buy four balconies for the windows in his home. This loan will serve to increase his business capacity and also have more security for his family with the instalations on the windows.

One of his aspirations is to improve his home for his family to feel more comfortable. He also wants to add more medicines to the business. This will allow him to attract customers who will help him to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, antibiotics, and sera.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, de 29 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es conviviente con José y con quien tiene 3 hijos de 13, 8 y 2 años de edad, vive en el terreno de su madre en donde construyó su casa en la parte trasera, junto a su familia comparte el día a día de trabajo y lucha constante por salir adelante. El trabajo de Celia consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas y alcohólicas. A diario acomoda en su congeladora todas las bebidas como gaseosas, agua mineral y cervezas, además pone a exhibir en una vitrina todas las golosinas que ofrece como chicles, caramelos, galletas y otros. Se abastece de las bebidas dos veces por semana mientras que la compra de golosinas lo hace de manera semanal. Realiza esta función hace tan solo 3 meses y espera seguir mejorando sus condiciones de trabajo con el paso del tiempo. Trabaja sola y lo hace muy bien. En ocasiones vende comida los fines de semana con ayuda de su cuñada, trabajo que viene cumpliendo desde hace 3 años. Recuerda que al principio le fue muy complicado realizar su trabajo ya que tenía su clientela consolidad, situación que ha podido revertir en este corto tiempo y ahora su negocio marcha adecuadamente, espera seguir trabajando mucho más y así continuar creciendo para mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. 
El monto solicitado 600 soles, lo destinará a la compra de cajas de gaseosas, agua mineral, golosinas y cervezas.
texts.en:
Celia is 29 years old. She is a friendly, kind, and hard working woman. She lives with Jose with whom she has three children. They are 13, 8, and 2 years old. She lives on the lot of her mother’s land where she built a house in the backyard. She works daily along with her family and constantly struggles to get ahead. 

Celia works to sell soft drinks and alcoholic beverages. Everyday she organizes her freezer with all the drinks such as soft drinks, mineral water, and beer. Additionally, she exhibits candy, bubble gum, cookies and other things in her display case. She purchases her drink supplies twice a week while she purchases candy once a week. 

She started her business only three months ago and wants to improve her working conditions as time goes by. She works by herself and does a very good job. Sometimes she sells food on the weekends with the help of her sister-in-law. She has been doing this work for three years. She remembers a time when it was complicated to do her job, but once she established her clientele the situation improved in a short time. Nowadays her business works adequately. She hopes to continue working more and thus improve her household income. 

This is her fourth loan. She is grateful to the people that give her the loan that she needs for working capital. She is committed to repaying it punctually. She is happy to be part of the community bank because they are very united and responsible. The loan for 600 soles will be used to purchase cases of soft drinks, mineral water, candy and beer.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks, mineral water, candy and beer.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana, se dedica a la venta de tamales comida es una persona de hogar vive con su hermana y una hija, ella tiene más de 20 años de estar dedicándose a este negocio, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hoy en día le ayuda para poder obtener ingresos y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprarse leña por mayoreo, hojas, pollo, aceite, maíz, bolsas, y algunas láminas para el techo de su casa, este préstamo servirá para invertir en los materiales que a diario utilizan en la elaboración de los alimentos de los tamales, mejorará asi su inventario teniendo la mano todo lo necesario para generar ventas.

Dentro de sus objetivos Juana tiene terminar la construcción de su vivienda, crecer en su negocio y que sus clientes se mantengan fieles para continuar ofreciéndoles productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Juana makes a living selling tamales. She is a woman of her home, and lives with her sister and a daughter.  She has spent more than 20 years making a living in this business and she learned it on her own initiative.  Today it helps her to be able to have an income and cover the necessities of her home.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy wholesale firewood, leaves, chicken, oil, corn, bags, and some plastic sheets for the roof of her house.  This loan will be used to invest in the ingredients that she uses to make the tamales.  In this way it will improve her inventory so that she has on hand everything she needs to generate sales.

Among Juana's goals is to finish the construction of her home, grow her business, and have her clients remain faithful so that she can continue offering them products of quality.

loans.use: to buy wholesale firewood, leaves, chicken, oil, corn, and bags.

loans.name: Jardines De La Luz Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JARDINES DE LA LUZ”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Ana Paula ella es soltera y tiene 19 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cafetín, la socia trabaja preparando comida y también sandwichs y empanadas,la socia vende gaseosas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hastas las 5:00 p.m,la socia tiene este negocio 3 años que junto con su mama lo administra el cafetin,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como panes, carne, pollo y verduras.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo despues de la reunion la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de floreria, negocio de cafetin, negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de agricultura.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “JARDINES DE LA LUZ” communal bank. It is located in the Cuzco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. 

This member's name is Ana Paula. She is single and 19 years old. She works in her business, which is a cafe. She makes meals and sandwiches and empanadas and sells sodas. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for 3 years. She manages the cafe with her mother. In her free time she likes to go out. With the loan she will buy products to cook such as bread, meat, chicken and vegetables.

The members who are pasted to the group photo were photographed after the meeting because they had to miss due to work reasons. The other members work selling flowers, in a cafe, raising animals, and selling agricultural products. 

Ana Paula is grateful to the people who have been a part of this dream in this way and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as bread, meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 45-years-old, married, and lives in Buchanan with seven children between the ages of 14 and 31 years old.  Two live at home and attend school while the others live on their own.  Their father is pastoring a church.  Victoria runs a shop in her community for the past fourteen years and she is requesting a loan to buy used clothes, body cream, powder, and other items for her business.  She hopes to build a house and to help all of her children.

loans.use: to buy used clothes, body cream, powder, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica a apoyar a su esposa en una venta de pupusas, él vive con su familia tienen dos hijos, las edades de ellos son de 4 y 8 años, él comenzó con su esposa en este negocio porque era un ingreso extra para su familia, lo administran juntos y lo atienden todos los días.

Solicita un préstamo para poder comprarse productos para la elaboración de la venta por ejemplo: aceite, condimentos, tomates, cebollas, chiles, chicharrones, y otros productos necesarios, esto le ayudará a aumentar posibilidades en el negocio de crecer en las ventas, ya que al tener todo lo necesario podrán atender más fácilmente la demanda.

Su objetivo a través del préstamo es generar en su negocio una condición estable, dándole la capacidad necesaria para poder ofertar buenos productos del gusto de los clientes.
texts.en:
Luis is dedicated to help his wife in the sale of pupusas (regional dish). He lives with his family. They have two children that are 8 and 4 years old. He started this business with his wife for additional income. They run it together and they tend to it everyday.
 
He is requesting a loan to purchase cooking supplies such as oil, spices, tomatoes, onions, chiles, and pork rinds, etc. This will increase the sales in his business and meet his demand.
 
His objective is to generate a stable business with enough capacity to offer good products that are delicious to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase oil, spices, tomatoes, onions, chiles, and pork rinds.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy tiene 24 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo dependiente. Vive en casa propia,  caserío Tejedores Bajo perteneciente en el Distrito de Tambogrande y no cuentan con  servicios básicos como luz eléctrica. 

La actividad que desarrolla Eloy, es la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral como actividad principal. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace aproximadamente más de 2 años.  Paralelamente trabaja como peón agrícola en parcelas aledañas.  Su esposa lo apoya en las actividades que realiza, y juntos sacan adelante a su familia.

Eloy anhela brindarle a su familia lo mejor.  Él ha decidido hacer mejoras en su vivienda, es por ello que ha solicitado 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Ely is 24 years old. He is married with one dependent child. He lives in his own home in Tejedores Bajo in the district of Tambogrande. They do not have services such as basic electricity in the area. Eloy grows sheep, pigs, and poultry. He has done this for the past 2 years. He also work as a farmer in the neighboring land. His wife supports in the work and together they try to get the family ahead.  He decided to improve his home and that is why he is requesting 1000 new soles to the credit union to achieve his objective.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Eslys

texts.es:
Eslys tiene 19 años de edad.  Vive en casa propia con su esposo y su menor hija. La casa está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande.  Eslys vive en la parte  rural del distrito, no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Ella cuenta con negocio de venta de ropa en su propio domicilio, para lo cual tiene clientela ya establecida en la zona. Atiende permanentemente y tiene más de 01 año de experiencia en el negocio, trabaja en un fundo agrícola y le pagan mensualmente.  A la vez se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y crianza de animales menores.  Con los ingresos que percibe apoya a su familia.

Eslys desea comprar más ropa para posteriormente venderla, especialmente para la campaña navideña.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Elsys is 19 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and young daughter.  The house is located in the district of Tambogrande.  Elsys lives in a rural part of the district and does not have basic services.

She relies on the business of selling clothing from her own home, for which she has already established customers in the area.  She attends to it permanently and has more than a year of experience in the business.  She works on an agricultural estate and they pay her monthly.  At the same time she makes a living selling groceries and raising small animals.  With the income that she receives she helps support her family.

Elsys wants to buy more clothing to sell later, especially for the Christmas season.  This is why she thought it would be a good idea to get a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Pierre Celestin

texts.en:
Pierre Celestin is 54 years old and is married to a farmer. They both have two children between 9 and 20 years old; they all go to school. Pierre Celestin has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs during maize production. The profits from his business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia. She is married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 15. Her husband is a businessman. Janet has been involved in business for the past 14 years, and says that she  received help from her  husband to improve  her business. She currently sells oil, rice, sugar and dry pepper, and enjoys interacting with her customers.

Janet is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, sugar, and dry pepper for her business Her goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, sugar, and dry pepper for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther owns a boutique where she sells new clothes and shoes. She has been in this business for the past seven years, earning  a monthly income of KES 60,000.

This will be Esther's fourth loan with KADET LTD of KES 100,000. She has repaid all her other loans successfully. 

With this loan  she plans to  purchase new clothes and materials. In the future, she would like to open a shop in Limuru town and become a successful business woman

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and materials.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with six children, and four go to school. She has two additional family members. 

She operates a pub at the market, buying on a wholesale basis. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin, food, and serving utensils. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to ease in transport and to own a fully stocked restaurant. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin, food, and serving utensils.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old and married.  He and his wife are blessed with two children.  Hs wife is a dressmaker who also supports the family. 

He has been earning a living through dairy farming for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 46,500.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy another dairy cow for the business. His plans for the anticipated profit are to add another dairy cow. 

His dreams and hopes in future are to be stable and be a wealthy farmer

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow for the business.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa is 40-years-old; she is a widow and lives in West Point. She has four children between the ages of 19 and 28 who are all independent adults and university students.

Massa has a table at the market where she sells dry fish. She has been involved in this business for the past ten years. Massa is proud of her business because she makes a profit from her sales; with the profit, she can buy more goods and improve her living condition. 

Massa has requested another loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. Her future goal is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with six children, and two of her children go to school. She takes care of an additional family member (mother). 

She is a poultry farmer. She operates her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of poultry feed, vaccines, and feeding utensils. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build more poultry houses and to become a large poultry farmer. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed, vaccines, and feeding utensils

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, se dedica a la siembra de pepinos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos dependen económicamente de él, las edades de sus hijos son un de 5 y 6 años, el negocio es la venta de la cosecha de pepinos, lo aprendió en su familia, trabaja todos los días desde las siete de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde, dentro de sus ventajas es que el terreno en el que realiza la siembra le queda cerca de su vivienda, dentro de sus dificultades esta el cambio de clima que le afecta el cultivo de pepinos.

El solicita un crédito para poder realizar el cultivo en una manzana de terreno, comprándose la semilla, el foliar, pago de mozos para preparar el terreno, esto le ayudará facilitándole los recursos económicos que le permitan mejorar su producción y generar más ingresos.

Un sueño de Miguel es comprarse un terreno a futuro donde pueda realizar sus cosechas en lo propio, esto le permitirá facilitarle todo el trabajo agrícola y si mejorar su oficio.
texts.en:
Miguel earns his living growing cucumbers. He lives with his wife and his children, who depend on him financially. His children are five and six years old.

Miguel's business, which he learned from his family, is the sale of his cucumber harvests. He works every day from seven o'clock in the morning until one o'clock in the afternoon. One thing he has going for him is that the land where he grows his crops is close to his house. Among his challenges are climate changes that affect cucumber crops. 

Miguel is requesting the loan so that he can plant a "manzana" [1.73 acres] of land, buying seed and fertilizer, and paying laborers to prepare the land. This will help him by providing the economic resources to allow him to improve his production and generate more income.

One of Miguel's dreams is to buy land where he can harvest his crops for himself in the future. This will allow him to reap all the benefits of his agricultural work, and thus improve in his trade.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Izetta

texts.en:
Izetta is 42 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married with six children between the ages of 9 and 24.

She has been selling rice and oil in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her aunt.  She enjoys the money she receives from her business every day.

Izetta is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business.  She hopes to improve her children's lives, educate them, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad tiene un negocio en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, en una zona eminentemente comercial;  en él  vende calzado en la línea deportiva e informal, para damas caballeros e infantil, negocio que nació desde hace 35 años cuando por espacio de 22, viajaba a Maicao, una ciudad fronteriza del país,  a comprar mercancías variada que distribuía entre comerciantes de colmenas; cuando adquirió buena experiencia  con su propio esfuerzo, compró una colmena y se instaló a vender en un punto fijo, en el que actualmente se encuentra. Los principales artículos de su oferta son sandalias, chancletas, y calzado deportivo, que vende de contado, desde las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Sus clientes, son transeúntes y comerciantes informales del sector que le compran a crédito y de contado. Los picos altos de ventas en su negocio, ocurren durante el segundo semestre del año, especialmente en el trimestre final, justamente en este periodo su capital de trabajo se vuelve insuficiente para responder a la gran demanda que tienen sus productos en su negocio. Esta es la razón por a cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen calzado, sandalias y chancletas, con ellas surtirá su negocio y responderá a los clientes que ya le han encardo. Su meta es ampliar su negocio, adquiriendo otro punto de ventas bien ubicado y su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo, no es suficiente para lograr  la meta a corto plazo, pero paso a paso ella con trabajo logrará alcanzarla.
texts.en:
Maria, 56 years old, has a business in the center of the city of Barranquilla in a predominantly commercial area.  In her store she sells sport and casual lines of shoes for women, men and children.  The business was born 35 years ago when, over a period of 22 years, she traveled to Maicao, a city on the border of the country, to buy varied merchandise that she distributed among the merchants in market stalls.  When she acquired good experience with her own effort, she bought a market stall and set up to sell in a fixed location, which is where she is currently located.  The main items that she offers are sandals, flip-flops and sports shoes that she sells for cash, from 8:30 in the morning until 6:00 in the afternoon.  Her customers are passersby and informal merchants of the area that buy from her on credit and with cash.  

The high peaks of sales in her business occur during the second half of the year, especially in the final quarter.  It is precisely in this period that her working capital becomes insufficient to respond to the high demand that her products have in her business.  This is the reason why she turns to a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy in greater volumes footwear, sandals and flip-flops.  With these she will stock her business and respond to the customers that have already ordered with her.  

Her goal is to expand her business, acquiring another well-located sales location and her greatest challenge is that her working capital is not sufficient to achieve the goal in the short term but step by step she, with work, will manage to reach it.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and flip-flops in greater volumes.

loans.name: Inti Raymi Colca Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento INTI RAYMI COLCA está compuesta por once integrantes de los cuales nueve son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Agustina  en viuda hace ya varios años, la Sra. Agustina se dedica a la  venta de verduras ella vende choclos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados más grandes de Cochabamba, este préstamo es el primero dentro de la institución, la Sra. Agustina va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción y construcción de su vivienda  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, la Sra. Agustina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que el tener que levantarse temprano para comprar sus verduras y la competencia y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando cosas para su vivienda, se siente feliz ya agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "INTI RAYMI COLCA" Communal Bank is composed of 11 members—nine women and two men—who earn their livings in different ways. 

The president of the bank is Agustina, who has been a widow for several years. Agustina works selling vegetables. She sells corn at her stand, which is located in one of Cochabamba's largest markets. 

This loan is her first with the institution, and Agustina is going to use it to purchase construction materials for the refurbishment and construction of her residence. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she wants her family to be more comfortable. 

Agustina is facing challenges in her business like competition and having to get up early to buy her vegetables. She is going to use her profits to continue buying materials for her house. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Florentine's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Florentine la responsable est âgée de 41ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgée et le moins ont respectivement 13ans et 05ans. Vendeuse ambulante de bonneterie depuis 5ans, elle s 'approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée de femmes. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Florentine se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of two women who are co-borrowers. Florentine, the group leader, is 41 years old; she is married and the mother of three children who attend school. The eldest and the youngest are 13 and 5 years old, respectively.

A traveling hosiery saleswomen for the past five years, Florentine gets her supplies from wholesalers in one of the outdoor markets. Her customers are mainly women. With the intention of increasing her capital and meeting customer demand, she has sought and obtained a loan from Finadev with an eye to maximizing her interest and contributing to her children's education. Florentine is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase 50 dozen bras and 50 dozen pairs of underwear.

loans.name: Angela Judith

texts.es: Angela de 26 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Soledad a 15 minutos de la ciudad; allí se dedica al comercio de productos alimenticios empacados o mecatos y también vende productos cosméticos, fantasía y perfumería, que promociona mediante guías  especializadas o catálogos, los cuales distribuye entre su clientela a quienes les otorga créditos, para que estos fácilmente puedan pagar el producto que desean de la oferta de Angela,  quien así mismo,  vende refrescos y bebidas como cervezas, gaseosas, los que ofrece principalmente los fines de semana y de contado. Su principal satisfacción es vender mercancías con descuentos especiales a su clientela, porque son muchas las ofertas que llegan en su revista y ella aunque hace sus pedidos, el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta,  no es suficiente para lograr invertir en todo lo que esta demanda le exige, mas los otros productos que vende de contado, como refrescos, bebidas  y mecatos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva con el cual comprará cosméticos, perfumeria, accesorios femeninos, mecatos, refrescos y bebidas, artículos que tienen rotación importante en este segundo periodo del año y con los cuales impactará a su clientela. Con su negocio tiene el sueño de hacerlo prosperar, con el fin de brindarle una educación de calidad a sus hijos; mientras trabaja con esmero para que esto ocurra, maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 15 días, una rentabilidad sobre las ventas promedia de un 15% indicadores desde los cuales hacemos las proyecciones de su crecimiento empresarial y auguramos muchos éxitos en su gestión.
texts.en: Angela is 26 years old. She lives in the community of Soledad, 15 minutes from the city. There she sells packaged foods and snacks, and she also sells cosmetics, women's accessories, and perfumes, which she publicizes through special guides or catalogs, which she distributes among her customers, to whom she offers credit, so that they can easily pay for the products they want from Angela's offerings. She also sells soft drinks and beverages such as beers and carbonated beverages, which she offers principally on weekends and for cash. Her principal satisfaction is selling merchandise with special discounts to her customers. Because there are many offers that arrive in her magazine, and even though she places her orders, the working capital that she has is not sufficient to manage to invest in everything that this demand requires of her, in addition to investing in the other products that sell for cash, such as soft drinks, beverages, and snacks. This is the reason why she is turning to a Kiva loan, with which she will buy cosmetics, perfumes, women's accessories, snacks, soft drinks, and beverages, articles that have an important turnover in this second period of the year and with which she will impact her customers. For her business, she has a dream of making it prosper, with the goal of offering a quality education to her children. While she works with conscientiousness so that this can happen, she manages a 15-day turnover on accounts receivable and an average profitability on sales of 15%, indicators from which we project her business growth and we predict much success in her management.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, women's accessories, snacks, soft drinks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Al-Mha Group

texts.en:
Maha is 39 years old, and married with six children.  She lives in Aden, Yemen, and is a member of a group called Al-mha, which is made up of six ladies in the same city.

Maha is a very active woman, and she sells different items like yeast and rechargeable phone cards. She works every day, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. She started her business by selling yeast to her neighbours, then she expanded her business to sell her products around the area.

Maha is requesting a loan of 50,000 Yemen Rial (YER) from AMB to buy yeast and rechargeable phone cards for her business. She hopes to open a general store to make more profit, and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy yeast, and rechargeable phone cards for her business.

loans.name: Juan Mario

texts.es:
Juan, necesita mejorar su venta de productos de limpieza, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de trapeadores, escobas, escobetones, desinfectantes y demás productos, esto le ayudara para darle estabilidad económica y a su familia.
El considera que el efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior, pudo surtir mas su negocio y ganar más clientela ofreciendo mas variedad, así mejorar su situación económica, él espera aumentar más sus utilidades, ademas ofrecer una mejor atención hacia sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan needs to improve his sales of cleaning products. For this reason, he is requesting a new loan so that he can buy mops, brooms, scrub brushes, disinfectants, and other products. This will help to provide financial stability for his family.

Juan says that his previous loan enabled him to restock his business with more inventory. As a result of offering more variety, he was able to gain more customers and improve his financial situation. He hopes to increase his profits even more and provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy mops, brooms, scrub brushes, disinfectants, and other products.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is a 40-year-old woman married to a farmer in Rwanda.  She has three children aged between 11 and 16 years old, who all go to school. She wants a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer, and to support labor costs during maize production. The profits from her business will be used to pay for her children’s tuition fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer, and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Chrisitine

texts.fr: Madame christine vit avec son conjoint maçon et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. L’ainé a 17ans et le dernier 13ans.  En 1992, elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son second crédit qu’elle sollicite de WAGES va lui servir à acheter des produits de premières nécessités. Elle veut aider son mari dans les charges du foyer et rendre son activité pérenne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Christine lives with her husband, a builder, and their three children in Lomé. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest is 13.

Since 1992, Mrs. Christine has been selling general foodstuffs from her home and getting her supplies in Lomé. Her second loan that she is seeking from WAGES will allow her to purchase essentials. She wants to help her husband with the household expenses and make her business sustainable.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es: Asunción, de 34 años, es una mujer alegre y muy dinámica. Cnonvive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 17 y 9 años y juntos habitan en una parte del terreno de su madre, ahí construyó una casa en la que actualmente vive. Ella junto a su pareja trabajan mucho ya que quieren progresar y dar una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos. El trabajo de Asunción consiste en la venta de ropa y sábanas. Ofrece al público diversas prendas y accesorios de cama en diversos diseños, colores y modelos. Su clientela básicamente son sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, además de algunos nuevos clientes que siempre llegan por recomendación. Algunas veces le solicitan pedidos con anticipación, los cuales reparte en el transcurso del día que recibe su mercadería. Lleva ya trabajando en este rubro 3 años, trabaja sola ya que su pareja busca por su lado otros ingresos para su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para hacer otras cosas adsemás que le da independencia economica y dispone de su tiempo para dirigirse a zonas o lugares donde pueda captar más clientes. Este es el crédito número 6 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2800 soles, comprará prendas de vestir y sábanas al por mayor ya que así compra a mejores precios logrando tener mayores ganancias por sus ventas.
texts.en:
Asunción, who is 34 years old, is a cheerful and very dynamic woman. She lives with her husband, with whom she has two children who are 17 and 9 years old. They all live together on part of her mother's property, where they built the house where they currently live. She and her husband work a lot since they want to get ahead and provide their children with a good education and diet. 

Asunción's work consists of the sale of clothing and linens. She sells various garments and various styles, colors, and models of bedding to the public. Her customers are basically her friends, family, and neighbors, along with new customers who always come on referrals. Sometimes, they order things from her in advance, which she distributes the same day that she receives her merchandise.

She has already been working in this field for three years. She works alone because her husband is also doing his part to earn money for their household. What Asunción likes about her work is that she has time to do other things as well, which gives her financial independence and frees up her time to go to other areas and places where she can win more customers. 

This is Asunción's sixth loan with MFP. She thanks all the people who make her loan possible so that she can continue doing her work with better results. In addition, she promises to once again make her loan payments punctually, as she did for the previous loans that she had.

She is also pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. With the amount requested (2,800 soles [PEN]), she will buy garments and linens from a wholesaler, since that's how she gets better prices and makes greater profits on her sales.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and linens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fabrics and bed linens to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is where many of Kenya's Olympic runners train. She has one child, and has been a farmer for 3 years.  Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, crops and personal business. She will use the loan to buy water pipes for irrigation.

Asked what she enjoys most about farming, and Emily replies 'I am my own boss!'. She says that her biggest challenge is bad debtors. 

Emily was asked how she found out about Juhudi Kilimo, and she said that she heard about the organisation on the radio. She added that she learnt learnt a lot about farming and how to make money out of it during Juhudi's required microfinance training session.

Her highest monthly expense is business related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Emily replied that she will be able to educate her child.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Emily owns cows and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards resulting from the loan. Currently, Emily has a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use.  This makes the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, de 36 años, es una mujer amable y muy carismática, le gusta mucho trabajar, es madre de tres niños quienes son fruto del amor que tiene con su conviviente, ella tiene su casa propia en donde vive a lado de su pareja, sus hijos y algunos hermanos, ella junto a los miembros de su familia trabajan día a día para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Doris consiste en el alquiler de equipos de sonidos. Brinda este servicio a personas interesadas en amenizar con buena música y sonido de calidad alguna actividad deportiva, cumpleaños, fiestas, eventos o cualquier reunión de confraternidad. Trabaja por lo general los fines de semana en donde tiene mayor demanda, sin embargo, durante la semana también consigue algunos contratos que le ayudan a percibir ingresos para sobrellevar los gastos diarios. Este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 10 años, siente que le va bien ya que su clientela se ha multiplicado. Además vende cosméticos en su casa como talcos, perfumes y cremas, los mismos que son exhibidos en una vitrina. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos además que se divierte desarrollando su labor, durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta actividad aprendió muchas cosas y continuamente está en busca de nuevos clientes por lo que espera seguir con su etapa de crecimiento. Su meta principal es implementar su trabajo con otros accesorios de sonido, por lo pronto va comprando poco a poco algunos instrumentos que son necesarios para que continúe brindando un buen servicio. Este es el préstamo número 1 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 700 soles, comprará cables de conexión eléctrica y otros implementos que usa en su trabajo de alquiler de equipos de sonido, además invertirá 200 soles en renovar su stock de cosméticos para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Doris, who is 36 years old, is a kind and very charismatic woman. She very much likes to work. She is the mother of three children who are the fruit of her love for her live-in partner. She has her own house, where she lives with her partner, her children, and some siblings. She, along with members of her family, works every day to have a better quality of life. Doris' work consists of renting sound equipment. She offers this service to people interested in entertaining with good music and quality sound for sporting events, birthdays, parties, events, or any type of fraternal gathering. In general she works on weekends, when she has greater demand. Nevertheless, during the week she also obtains some engagements that help her to receive income to meet the daily expenses. She has been doing this work for 10 years. She feels that it is going well for her since her customers have multiplied. In addition, she sells cosmetics in her home, such as powders, perfumes, and creams, which are exhibited in a showcase. What she likes about her work is that it generates good income, and in addition she enjoys developing her business. During the time that she has been doing this work, she has learned many things and is continually searching for new customers, and consequently she hopes to continue with this period of growth. Her principal goal is to set up her work with other sound accessories, and for now she is buying, little by little, some instruments that are necessary so that she can continue offering good service. 

This is her first loan from MFP, and therefore she is grateful to those who make possible her access to this credit, so that she can continue with the accomplishment of her goals. Furthermore, she promises to be punctual with her payments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very united people. With the 700 PEN that she has applied for, she will buy electrical connection cables and other equipment that she uses in her work of renting sound equipment. In addition, she will invest 200 PEN in refreshing her stock of cosmetics to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy electrical connection cables and other equipment that she uses in her work of renting sound equipment.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is 30 years old and lives in Azerbaijan. He is married with two children, and his eldest child is going to school. For the past 3 years, Ilham has been working hard to manage a boutique which sells shoes. As a result, he has managed to grow the business and he has opened another clothes boutique. 

The loan will be used to buy more shoes and clothes for resale. Ilham plans to further develop his business, as he wants to support his children's education to give them a modern education at an advanced level. He works hard to realize his goals by adding goods that will attract more customers, and produce greater profits.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 64 years old. He is married to another farmer and they have six children, all of them go to school. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years.
