loans.use: to pay for rice grains and laborers' salaries for her rice mill

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam runs a little shop. She started this business with her husband 5 years ago. The shop is located on the first floor of Mariam's house. Mariam not only has her permanent clients, but also distributes goods to the local kindergarten. Mariam has applied for this loan to increase the variety of goods in her shop. This will allow her to meet the clients' demands and increase her sales. 

Mariam lives with her husband, little son, daughter, and father-in-law. Business income is vital for Mariam to have a stable income and sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for food, drinks, and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is 43 years old and single. Luvisminda works very hard to provide for herself.

Luvisminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Luvisminda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Luvisminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en: Herminda is a 52-year-old resident of Kapalaran, Tambulig. She provides her four children's needs from the little amount of 20,000 PHP she has earned monthly from her own piggery business for 4 years, as an aid to the income earned by her husband. However, in 2010 she became a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan from GDMPC micro finance of 40,000  PHP to buy feeding supplies. Herminda wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Al-Ayhm Group

texts.en:
These are the four members of the Al-Ayhm group. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sana`a, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 110,000 YER. Hajr is the leader of the group. She is 26 years old. She is the woman holding a paper in the photo. She is a tailor who has been sewing fabrics, veils, scarves and various clothes for five years. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She started her business in her house. She is developing her skills to be professional tailor in her area. 

Hajr`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy sewing materials for her business. Because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the reinvestment she makes from each loan. In the future, she would like to save her profit to open a sewing factory.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 36 years old, married and has two children. Marilyn is from Kapalaran, Tambulig and been 19 years in farming, earning an amount of 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilyn joined GDMPC. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop season. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop season

loans.name: El Valle De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Verelicia Anne, es socia del grupo "El Valle de Huaquillay", formado por cinco socios, ella fué elegida por sus compañeros como la tesorera del grupo. Este grupo ha obtenido su segundo desembolso ya que se han caracterizado por ser un grupo puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
La Sra. Verelicia Anne, tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, es casada. Ella se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de productos naturales, éste negocio se lo recomendó una amiga y ella lo inició cuando tenía la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Paralelamente ofrece servicios de masoterapia.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos naturales para aumentar su stock, ya que es mucho mas fácil desarrollar el negocio cuando se tiene los productos a la mano.
Agradece a los inversionistas por su apoyo ya que gracias a ellos puede lograr sus metas y hacer realidad sus sueños y el sueño de cada socio integrante del grupo.
texts.en: Verelicia Anne is one of the five members of the group 'El Valle de Huaquillay' (the valley of Huaquillay). She was elected treasurer of the group by the others members. This is the second cycle of loans for this group, earned because they were very punctual and responsible in their repayments during the first cycle. Verelicia Anne is fifty-two years old, married, and has three sons. She has been selling natural products for two years, a business she started on a friend's recommendation when she needed to start helping her husband with household expenses. She also offers massage therapy. She will invest the loan towards buying natural products to increase her stock, since it is always easier to develop one's business when one has the products close at hand. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support, which will enable her to reach her goals and make her dreams come true, as well as to further the dreams of her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: F.mahoutin Gislène

texts.fr: Agée de 31ans, Gislène est mariée et mère de 03 enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 13ans et 03ans. Eleveur des porcs dans un coin du Bénin depuis 02ans, elle s'approvisionne dans les fermes. Dans le but de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de couvrir à la demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Gislène is 31 years old, married and the mother of three children - all in school. The eldest and youngest are, respectively, 13 and 3 years old. She is a pig farmer in a region of Bénin and has been for two years - she buys her inputs from the local farms.
With the intention of increasing her purchasing power, and to meet the never-ending growth in demand from her customers, she has sought financing from Finadev to help her maximise her profits and to help pay the childrens school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fifty pigs.

loans.name: Bendera 1 Zone Group

texts.en:
Sri, 47, is married and blessed with three children. She lives in Kalisari in the east of Jakarta. 

She has a grocery store business and has been running it for four years in front of her house. Her husband has a business. He sells noodles around the neighborhood. 

With her profit from her business, she can cover her house rent fee of 500,000 IDR every month. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy kids' snacks and cold drinks.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mary Suzzete

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Suzete works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Mary Suzete is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Mary Suzete has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa lives in Shaghap village, Ararat region, with her husaband, son, and daughter. Larisa's husband works at the local school and helps the family to run a farm, where they raise livestock and cultivate wheat, onions, peppers, and fruit trees. Larisa has applied for this loan to get necessary means to complete the autumn sawing. With the requested amount she plans to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for her tractor. This is important for Larisa to have a good harvest of wheat next year and get enough income to invest in agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is 25 years old, married, and blessed with two children that he supports. He has done bean farming for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES 4,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 5,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm. 

The anticipated profits will pay for his children's school fees. His future dream is improved family living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm

loans.name: Richelyn

texts.en:
Richelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling native hats in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her native hats.

Richelyn has been in this business for 20 years. Richelyn earns additional income by raising pigs and selling fruits (bananas).

Richelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native hat-making business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 40 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school.

Rosana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Rosana has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed twelve times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Hammer

texts.es:
Hammer tiene 20 años. Vive con sus padres y sus 2 hermanos. Todos ellos habitan una casa rústica pero propia construida en un distrito agrícola. Hammer es un joven esmerado y trabajador. Desde los 15 años ayuda a sus padres en el trabajo agrícola. Ahora que sus padres le heredaron 2 parcelas puede producir con libertad los productos que él considera rentables, como son papas, arvejas y maíz. Pero además produce en otros terrenos que arrienda. “Normalmente siembro como 40 sacos de semillas de papa al año y 4 bolsas de semillas de arveja”, dice. Su producción es abundante y logra vender con satisfacción en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, cuyos compradores llevan la mercadería hacia distintas ciudades del país, como son Lima, Arequipa, Ica y otras ubicadas en la costa del Perú.
Hace 2 meses sembró 20 sacos de papas y espera de su apoyo para comprar fertilizantes y continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Siempre Juntos”, es el nombre de su banco comunal del que se siente contento y a gusto por el respaldo de personas solidarias.
Destinará los 1500 soles en la compra de bolsas de guano de corral para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en: Hammer is twenty years old. He lives with his parents and his two brothers. They all live together in a rustic house of their own, built in an agricultural district. Hammer is an enthusiastic and hard-working young man. He has been helping his parents with the farm since he was fifteen. Now that his parents have gifted him with two parcels, he can grow whatever produce he considers to be most profitable, such as potatoes, peas, and sweetcorn. He also grows produce in other fields, which he rents. "I usually sow around 40 sacks of potato seeds and 4 sacks of pea seeds a year', he tells us. His harvest is always plentiful and he manages to sell his produce at a good price at the wholesale market of Tarma. The buyers then sell the merchandise in various cities of the country, such as Lima, Arequipa, Ica, and other cities of the coast. Two months ago, Hammer sowed twenty sacks of potato seeds and is hoping from some help from Kiva lenders in order to buy fertiliser and keep tending to his crops. This is his third loan with field partner MFP, and he promises to be punctual in his monthly repayments. He belongs to communal bank 'Siempre Juntos' ('Always Together'), with which he is very happy because of the support and solidarity shown by the members. He will use this loan to buy guano from poultry pens to use as organic fertiliser for his potato plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of guano to use as organic fertiliser.

loans.name: Simorina

texts.en:
Simorina is 25 years old and she has a child that studies in primary school. She works with her husband in the same business which is a store.

She is applying for a loan to buy some additional stock. She has a store that sells basic supplies such as coffee, sugar and vegetables.She opened her kiosk a long time ago. It is in the central market. She has got a lot of customers that come to buy her stock.  

Simorina is a reliable client who has already received loans from TRM that she paid back on time. She makes a good income from her business and she wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy some additional stock for her  store

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de esforzado que desde pequeño trabajo con su papa, el cual le dio las herramientas para trabajar independientemente. Este prestamo de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) le ayudara a aumentar la venta de queso para obtener mayores ingresos. Para el la empresa ha sido un impacto importante, un canal por el cual sus sueños se pueden hacer realidad.
Para el futuro espera poder tener mas crias y hacerlas producir para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a determined gentleman. At a young age he began working with his father, who gave him the tools he needed to work independently. This loan of 1,000,000 CRC will help him to increase his sale of cheese so that he can obtain more income. His business has an important impact since it is the means by which his dreams can become reality.

In the future, he hopes to have more cattle to raise so that he can produce more, thus enabling him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cattle and to pay for their care.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en: Gurgen lives in Goris town with his mother, Viktoria. Gurgen works as an engineer at a local factory. In addition, he is in agriculture. Gurgen currently is raising three cows and keeps 25 beehives. Gurgen would like to increase the number of beehives, for which he needs funds. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 12 colonies of bees. This will allow Gurgen to increase income from the sales of honey and continue investing in the expansion of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for 12 colonies of bees

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell through her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice and through a motorcycle transport business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from her general store.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase of fishing materials

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Prima requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, bags, blouses and other clothing. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Prima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, bags, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Marilyn has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Sucett

texts.en:
Sucett is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Sucett has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from raising pigs, buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction), and a general store.

Sucett has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es: El Sr. Clemente tiene 54 años y tres hijos de las edades de 14, 12, y 8 años, el  se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Cañada,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Clemente va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de Mani y yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,   y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Clemente is 54 years old and has three children (ages 14, 12, and 8). He is a farmer who plants a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes, cassava, and corn on a parcel of land that he owns in the community of Cañada.

This loan is his first with Emprender. Sr. Clemente will use the loan to plant peanuts and cassava, which involves having to prepare the land. His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can have the necessary resources for planting and maintaining his crops. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family since he is responsible for all of the household expenses. Sr. Clemente is a responsible and hardworking person who is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting peanuts and cassava.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita de 23 años convive hace 6 años con José de 25 años. Ambos tienen 1 hija de 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa rústica y propia en un anexo rural. Margarita es una mujer organizada y carismática. Se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de arvejas en sus distintas variedades. A parte de eso cultivan papas de color y blancas, habas, alfalfa, flores de gladiolos, etc. “Sembrar de todo es bueno y es rentable, porque si no me va bien con la papa, recupero con los otros productos. La agricultura es así”, cuenta. 
La venta es inmediata, pues llegan compradores de distintas partes del país para llevarse los productos frescos. Con el pasar del tiempo, Margarita piensa comprarse un auto para que José realice servicios de transportes interprovincial, lo cual según compañeros es muy rentable y conveniente. Pero por ahora dice que, se esmerará en el cultivo de sus diversos productos. Este mes se encargará de esparcir abono orgánicos, por ello solicita una vez más de su apoyo. Éste es su préstamo número 3 con MFP. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal participativo.  Menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Con los 1000 soles podrá adquirir semillas de alfalfa, y 5 bolsas de abono orgánicos para garantizar su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Margarita, 23, has lived for six years with José, 25.  Together they have a four-year-old daughter.  They live in their own home, a rustic house in a rural area.

Margarita's an organized and charismatic woman.  She works in agriculture, especially growing different types of pea.  She also grows different varieties of potato and beans, alfalfa, gladiolus, etc.  "Growing a bit of everything is good and it's profitable," she says, "because if the potatoes don't do well, I can recover with the other products.  That's the way agriculture is."

Her sales are immediate because buyers come from different parts of the country to get fresh products.  In time Margarita plans to buy a car so José can offer inter-province transportation service, which is profitable and convenient according to their friends.  For now, though, she says she'll put her effort into her different products.

This month she needs to spread organic fertilizer, so once again she's requesting your help.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She's happy to belong to a participatory communal bank.  She says she'll make her monthly payments punctually.

With the 1000 soles [PEN] she'll be able to get alfalfa seeds and five sacks of organic fertilizer to guarantee their growth.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan, tiene la necesidad de invertir en su nuevo cultivo agricola, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, y así poder mejorar la produccion en el cultivo y al mismo tiempo asegurando la alimentacion para su familia.
El nos comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar, las condiciones en su familia han mejorado.
texts.en:
Juan needs to invest in his new agricultural crop. This is why he is asking for a new loan for the purchase of goods like fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides. In this way, he can improve the production of his crops and at the same time make sure that he can feed his family. 

He tells us that his last loan helped him grow and have everything he needed to work. His family's living conditions have improved.

loans.use: to purchase goods like fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides

loans.name: Hedda

texts.en: Hedda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Hedda requested an 11,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her store. In the future, Hedda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.en:
Ma. Lita is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Lita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Lita has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing/fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in Dashtakar village, Ararat region, with her husband, son and father-in-law. Laura is a nurse at a local hospital, and her husband is a police officer. Unfortunately, their salaries are too low to make ends meet, and the couple also runs a farm to have additional income from agriculture. 

Laura keeps cows and a mother pig, grows grass, which she uses as forage for the cattle, and grows fruit trees. 

Laura wants to grow a special sort of grass to feed the cattle. For this aim, she plans to purchase grass seeds. Laura also wants to purchase grass to feed the cattle during winter, saplings for her orchard, as well as young pigs. 

Implementation of all these purchases will allow Laura to gather more income from agriculture and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, saplings, grass, and young pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth con su previo credikiva, compró artículos de papelería como cuadernos, cartulinas, plastilina y a productos de aso personal, además de un congelador. Con este credikiva pudo ampliar su número de clientes pues vendió más papelería y muchos refrescos y bebidas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito de artículos de aseo personal, como dentífricos, jabones, desinfectantes y mas mercancías variadas como accesorios, calzado etc., para vender en mayor volumen el último trimestre del año, época en la cual usualmente se incrementan el volumen de sus ventas. Ella envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias por financiar mi negocio y como el crédito anterior espero responder a su confianza.
texts.en:
With her last Kiva loan, Elizabeth bought school and office supplies like notebooks, note cards, and erasers, and personal hygiene products, along with a freezer. With the loan, she was able to increase her customer base and sell more office supply products and a lot of soft drinks and refreshments as well. 
Currently, she is applying for a loan for personal hygiene products, like tooth paste, soaps, sanitizers, and a variety of other merchandise like accessories, footwear, etc. The goal is to increase sales in the last quarter of the year, the season when sales are usually up. She sends a message to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you so much for financing my business. As with the last loan, I hope to live up to your trust."

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products, like tooth paste, soaps, sanitizers, and a variety of other merchandise like accessories, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Belen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading. Belen is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 46 years old and married with four children.

Tessie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries.

Tessie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Tessie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries for sale

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 58, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Liza operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, sell them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liza hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to have her own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise for sale
